title: newCommercial Lines Underwriter (Construction)
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is one of Canada’s largest Managing Underwriting Agencies. A leader in the Specialty Insurance industry, 100% Canadian owned. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization, our valued employees, our partners and clients.

Whether you’re starting your career or taking it to the next level, Premier offers a unique environment for you to grow & succeed. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

DEPARTMENT/LOCATION: Commercial Lines (Construction), London or Vancouver
POSITION: Commercial Underwriter

Job Accountabilities:

In this position, you will underwrite and develop our Commercial portfolio, with the mandate to grow profitability, maintaining exceptional working relationships with our brokers/agents. This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise to provide support within the Commercial/Professional lines team. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve broker/agent inquiries, and someone who is capable of making operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

Qualifications & Skills Required:

  • Minimum 1-3 years of company underwriting experience, handling/quoting mid-sized Commercial accounts
  • CIP or working towards completing CIP courses
  • Good solid relationships
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • A high standard of service in handling queries
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

About Premier:

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products. www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment.

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc.

title: newReceptionist
description:
Company Background

Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd. is an industry leading Managing General Agent established over 20 years ago. Our roots derive from a long serving sports, entertainment and lifestyle insurance provider (Sports-Can Insurance Consultants) and we have grown to encompass a wide range of niche and specialty products including aviation, marine, specialty casualty, accident, AD&D and hard to place property.

We are looking to add to our growing team with a full-time permanent receptionist/processor. This position is suitable for those without any industry knowledge, but who hold some form of customer service experience as this is an entry-level position.

**This position is based in-office 5 days per week as part of a small core group of full-time in-office staff.**

Duties:

- Reception – answering & transferring calls

- Accepting deliveries as required

- Process/typing a variety of insurance related documents

- Process policy changes, certificates & endorsements as required

- Assist underwriting staff with servicing files & attaching pertinent information to files

- Communicate with brokers via e-mail & telephone

- Clerical duties, such as electronic filing & maintenance of records

Minimum Job Qualifications & Key Personal Attributes:

- Strong organizational & time management skills to complete assignments effectively and within structured timelines

- Strong writing/language & communication skills

- Keen eye for detail

- Interest in being involved with community outreach and company culture

- Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Office 365 & Google Drive is an asset

- High school diploma

- Customer service experience – positive & professional communication skills

- Double vaccinated against Covid-19

What SRIM has to offer:

- A fulfilling company culture that provides personal support & mentorship, professional growth & career advancement opportunities

- A positive & collaborative environment

- Teammates are rewarded on performance & achievement of goals

- We encourage and subsidize continuing education & professional designations

- Extended medical & dental benefits through Canada Life

- Employee Stock Purchase Plan through our parent company Brown & Brown, Inc. (BRO)

- RRSP Matching Program

Job Type: Full-time Permanent (37.5 hrs/week)

Location: Langley (in-office) - must reside in Metro Vancouver/Fraser Valley

Starting Salary: $35,000-$40,000

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $35,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
Our office has very a limited number of visits, primarily from delivery services. Masks are required. We are strictly observing the current PHO guidelines. Proof of vaccination required.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $36,500.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Our office has very a limited number of visits, primarily from delivery services. Masks are required. We are strictly observing the current PHO guidelines. Proof of vaccination required.

Education:

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • MS Word: 2 years (preferred)
  • Customer Service: 2 years (preferred)

title: Underwriter
description:
You’re excited by a challenge.
You’re passionate about building relationships with brokers, giving great service, and the world of underwriting and risk assessment
If you’re answer is yes, check out this Underwriter role at Cowan Insurance Group.
What’s the ask?
Reporting to the Director, Commercial Insurance, the Underwriter is responsible for underwriting the personal and commercial accounts, including marine pleasure craft, self-storage, and high-risk residential programs. The incumbent will underwrite in accordance with the guidelines and rules applicable to the programs, provide quotes on new business, process renewals, policy changes and cancellations. As an Underwriter you will be responsible for developing relationships with the broker networks, attend industry events and assist management in the implementation of new programs, new systems and new procedures. You will be involved in program audits, annual program reviews, recommendations/referrals for enhanced coverages, carrier relationship building, systems changes and claims.
What does it take?

  • Previous underwriting experience in PI or CI required
  • Knowledge of various underwriting tools an asset such as BVS, etc.
  • Lloyds coverholder processes and bordereaux experience an asset
  • Knowledge of boats would be an asset (either power or sail)
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • High level of self-motivation with ability to perform effectively with minimal supervision
  • Attention to detail and ability to process large volume of transactions accurately
  • Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS office products
  • Working towards CIP designation an asset
  • RIBO license or ability to obtain.

Who we are

Canadian-owned and operated, Cowan Insurance Group is a leading independent insurance brokerage and consulting operation, providing real value to our clients. With close to 500 employees operating out of 12 locations across Canada, we’re proud to have been named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2012.
We partner with leading national and international insurance companies to:

  • deliver insurance and risk management solutions to businesses, organizations and individuals
  • advise on and create retirement, group benefits, disability management and international benefits programs for employee groups.

We also offer wealth and asset management as well as financial and succession planning services to individuals, and specialize in property, casualty and credit insurance.
What sets us apart?
Be in good company
Integrity matters. It drives our award-winning workplace culture and fuels our collective desire to help our clients, employees, and communities thrive.
Challenge your thinking
You're valued for your passion, drive and creativity. The pace is fast but the work is meaningful, interesting, and complex, just the way you like it.
Grow together
We believe in your potential. If you’re looking to develop your expertise with learning opportunities and mentoring, we’ll make that happen.
Benefits and perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Participate in our comprehensive benefits plan on day one — no waiting period
  • Company-matched Retirement Plan
  • Company-paid training and development courses
  • Community involvement

Are you interested?
Send your cover letter and resume and share your unique story with us.
While we appreciate the interest of all applicants, we will contact only those selected for interviews. If you are an applicant with disabilities and require accommodations, please let us know at the time of our contact so that we may arrange for their provision.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employee candidates will be selected strictly on the basis of an individual's technical qualifications, knowledge and experience, as they relate to the requirements of a particular position. Selections will be made without regard to: race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed (religion), sex, sexual orientation, handicaps (physical or mental), age, marital status, family status, or the receipt of public assistance or record of offences.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Claims Examiner
description:
:
Responsibilities:
  • Working as a Third Party Administrator in the investigation, analysis, and direct oversight of full case load of nationwide first party property, liability and inland marine claims, with the opportunity to expand responsibilities into other lines of business.
  • Target identification of subrogation opportunities and lead recovery efforts.
  • Review independent adjuster reports for accuracy, and direct the investigation of your claims.
  • Promptly communicate with Lloyd’s of London brokers and underwriting and claims personnel of other Carrier clients to provide outstanding customer service and results.
  • Promptly communicate with insureds, claimants, retail agents, general agents, independent adjusters and attorneys as necessary. Strategize and take action to obtain best possible results for claims.
  • This position requires a high degree of knowledge with regard to all aspects of first and third party coverage.
  • Must be able to review insurance policy coverage, and prepare reservation of rights or declination letters when appropriate.
  • Be an organized, effective communicator, and possess excellent analytical, writing, negotiation, and follow-up skills
Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education
  • Ability to read, understand, and apply policy terms
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of first-party property and third-party liability adjusting experience
  • Third party adjusting experience an advantage
  • Insurance designations and commitment to ongoing insurance education preferred
  • Exemplary customer service
  • Ability to accurately handle a full case load in a fast paced environment
  • Ability and willingness to commit to extended schedules following significant catastrophe losses
  • Outstanding organizational skills and maintenance of diary system
  • Competence in using MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook and the ability to learn new IT applications such as carrier or TPA systems
The Ideal Candidate:
  • You’re organized and a master multi-tasker. You are attentive to detail and can effectively manage your time and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • You’re analytical. You connect the dots and apply what you learned to solve problems.
  • You take initiative. You don’t wait until you are told what to do. You anticipate project needs and are resourceful in getting the required information to get your job done.
  • You’re a collaborative and business savvy individual willing to work across business units with a variety of stakeholders, demonstrating curiosity to learn beyond your own function.
  • You’re a team-player. Our office has a collaborative atmosphere where learning from others and teaching others is important.
  • You’re professional and client-oriented. We service clients across the globe and take pride in our professional work environment and reputation.
  • You take ownership of the success of the organization and your actions contribute directly to our growth and profitability.
About Our Company:
Kaufman Claims is a subsidiary of the H.W. Kaufman Group. Our family of companies comprises a vast network of over 50 offices across the globe. From brokerage, underwriting, premium financing and real estate to claims and loss control, together we are shaping the future of insurance.

title: Personal Lines Specialist
description:
Personal Insurance Specialist
Winnipeg, Manitoba

Our client, Nation West Insurance Brokerage, is looking for a Personal Insurance Specialist to join their team. They are seeking an insurance professional who can provide personal insurance expertise to the new and existing clients for their homes, condos, rental properties, and contents.

As the Personal Insurance Specialist, you will be responsible for:

  • Responding to inquiries from existing clients by phone, email, or in person.
  • Contacting existing clients regarding renewals to ensure accuracy of information and coverage on a timely basis.
  • Retaining existing client business by seeing to their Personal Insurance needs.
  • Effectively seeking new business and quotes on the Personal Insurance needs of prospective clients.
  • Assisting walk-in customers with Autopac and Travel Health needs.
  • Responding to inquiries from prospective clients by phone, email or in-person by gathering relevant information and quotes on Personal Insurance needs.
  • Keeping up to date on insurance market products and changes.
  • Undertaking various administrative duties as required including but not limited to mail sorting & distribution, couriers, light cleaning, filing, printer refills, MPI inventory, open and close duties.
You and Your Experience:
  • You have a Level 2 Insurance License.
  • You have a minimum of a year of experience in the insurance broker industry with a well-developed knowledge of personal insurance.
  • You have superior customer service skills.
  • You have excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • You are proficient in utilizing Broker Management systems, residential rebuilding programs and various Broker Portals to service client files.
  • You have the ability to use judgment and reasoning to solve practical problems.
  • You are available on evenings and weekends, if needed.

About Nation West Insurance Brokerage:

Starting in 1937, C.W. Pooles & Co. operated for 69 years under the same name. Under new ownership, from 2006 to 2011 their brokerage operated in partnership with another local brokerage; this timeline included the 2009 acquisition of Regent Insurance Brokers.

Their vision for the future would include a new name and distinct brand. They are a Western Canadian Brokerage, focused on serving the rich mosaic of Canadian society.

On January 1st, 2012 a new era was launched when they rebranded as Nation West Inc. o/a Nation West Insurance Brokerage. In 2013 they added Nation West Marine Insurance and Nation North Insurance Brokerage as distinct divisions under our corporate umbrella.

Nation West is one of Manitoba’s leading insurance brokerages, with a rapidly growing client base. They are looking to expand their team of client care specialists!

How to Apply:

Please apply online at www.peoplefirsthr.com/jobs/ or by emailing your resume (in MS WORD format) in confidence to Brittney Frias at bfrias@peoplefirsthr.com

For further information about this career opportunity, please feel free to contact Tara Gousseau at 204-940-3298.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected will be contacted for an interview.

title: Engineering Field Specialist
description:
We have a career opportunity for Boiler Machinery Engineers for the BC and Quebec region. Reporting to Engineering Supervisor, you will manage an assigned inspection territory, providing jurisdictional inspections; loss prevention, and claims adjusting. You will be responsible to Engineering Underwriting for technical support.
Accountabilities:
  • You will own the inspection of insured risks to assess exposures and equipment, production flow and safe operation of equipment, and jurisdictional inspections.
  • Your ability to successfully handle loss adjustment investigations from date reported to final invoices will be key in this role.
  • Motivation and diligence in the approach to being fully versed in the interpretation of all policy forms.
  • Your fluid communication skills, and existing knowledge will be instrumental in writing inspection reports and certificates of inspection.
  • We pride ourselves in quality assurance, your focus will be the completion of repair approvals and the administration aligned to the task.
  • Ability to craft survey reports for quotes on complex accounts prior to binding is a requirement.
  • Working with and building relationships with Brokers to provide marketing services and accompany brokers on site visits.
Required Qualifications and Knowledge:
  • 3 to 5 years' experience in building or production facility maintenance
  • Post-secondary technical education / apprentice
  • Strong communication and the ability to interact with others with technical and non-technical verbiage
  • Bilingualism ( for the Quebec region role )
  • Self-motivated, organized, and a dedication to meeting deadlines are essential to the success of the role.
  • Proficiency in MS word, excel, power point, and experience with databases.
  • We asked that you have a valid driver’s license due to the required travel in the role.
  • A post-secondary engineering degree or diploma is required
  • Marine engineer 2nd class / stationary engineer 2nd class
  • Background in non-destructive testing
  • Knowledge of ASME codes
  • National Board Commission
  • CIP, CRM
  • This is a field role and part of a virtual team. Working from home and extensive travel for inspections, claims, and broker training is a requirement. Flexibility is a requirement for this role.

title: Reception
description:
Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers.
Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd. is an industry leading Managing General Agent established over 20 years ago. Our roots derive from a long serving sports, entertainment and lifestyle insurance provider (Sports-Can Insurance Consultants) and we have grown to encompass a wide range of niche and specialty products including aviation, marine, specialty casualty, accident, AD&D and hard to place property.
We are looking to add to our growing team with a full-time permanent receptionist/processor. This position is suitable for those without any industry knowledge, but who hold some form of customer service experience as this is an entry-level position.
**This position is based in-office 5 days per week as part of a small core group of full-time in-office staff.**
Duties:
  • Reception – answering & transferring calls
  • Accepting deliveries as required
  • Process/typing a variety of insurance related documents
  • Process policy changes, certificates & endorsements as required
  • Assist underwriting staff with servicing files & attaching pertinent information to files
  • Communicate with brokers via e-mail & telephone
  • Clerical duties, such as electronic filing & maintenance of records
Minimum Job Qualifications & Key Personal Attributes:
  • Strong organizational & time management skills to complete assignments effectively and within structured timelines
  • Strong writing/language & communication skills
  • Keen eye for detail
  • Interest in being involved with community outreach and company culture
  • Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Office 365 & Google Drive is an asset
  • High school diploma
  • Customer service experience – positive & professional communication skills
  • Double vaccinated against Covid-19
What SRIM has to offer:
  • A fulfilling company culture that provides personal support & mentorship, professional growth & career advancement opportunities
  • A positive & collaborative environment
  • Teammates are rewarded on performance & achievement of goals
  • We encourage and subsidize continuing education & professional designations
  • Extended medical & dental benefits through Canada Life
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan through our parent company Brown & Brown, Inc. (BRO)
  • RRSP Matching Program
Job Type: Full-time Permanent (37.5 hrs/week)
Location: Langley (in-office) - must reside in Metro Vancouver/Fraser Valley
Starting Salary: $35,000-$40,000
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We take pride in the diversity of our team and seek diversity in our applicants.

title: Underwriter - Commercial Lines
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is one of Canada’s largest Managing Underwriting Agencies.  A leader in the Specialty Insurance industry, 100% Canadian owned. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization, our valued employees, our partners and clients.

Whether you’re starting your career or taking it to the next level, Premier offers a unique environment for you to grow & succeed. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following: 

DEPARTMENT/LOCATION:   Commercial Lines (Construction), London or Vancouver 

POSITION:  Commercial Underwriter

Job Accountabilities:

In this position, you will underwrite and develop our Commercial portfolio, with the mandate to grow profitability, maintaining exceptional working relationships with our brokers/agents. This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise to provide support within the Commercial/Professional lines team. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve inquiries, and someone who is capable of making operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

Qualifications & Skills Required:

  • Minimum 1-3 years of company underwriting experience, handling/quoting mid-sized Commercial accounts
  • CIP or working towards completing CIP courses
  • Good solid relationships
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • A high standard of service in handling queries
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

About Premier: 

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment. 

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc. 

How to Apply for this Position: 

Interested applicants are requested to submit their cover letter and resume outlining their qualifications to sandra.chow@premiergroup.ca . We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, please note only those under consideration will be contacted. 

Equal Opportunity Employer

Premier is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: Director - Quebec
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is one of Canada’s largest Managing Underwriting Agencies.  A leader in the Specialty Insurance industry, 100% Canadian owned. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization, our valued employees, our partners and clients.

Whether you’re starting your career or taking it to the next level, Premier offers a unique environment for you to grow & succeed. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

Position: Director – Quebec, Laval

We are looking for someone who will lead our growing Quebec region into the future. We need a dynamic individual who can leverage all of our existing resources and talent to help us expand. Do you have the drive and the leadership experience to take this exciting role on? If you do, then we have a great position for you to work in a professional agile dynamic environment with a competitive compensation plan.

Job accountabilities will include: 

In this position for our Branch Office in Laval (with the assistance of the Executive Team) you will play a critical part in enhancing and developing Premier’s reputation with Quebec broker force. Simultaneously you will also be responsible for building the team as the portfolio of business continues to expand for the Quebec region.

This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve broker inquiries, and someone who is capable of making leadership and operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

  • Working with Executive for Broker relationship building, creating promotional material for the benefit of both internal teams and external brokers. Assisting with presenting/attending/creating Broker Seminars.
  • Lead and continue to develop all underwriting teams working with our Underwriting Leadership Team across Canada. Establish and promote a team environment based on high trust and performance Ensuring alignment of individual roles and performance with our business model
  • Working with Claims Team on emerging claims issues and loss experience/trends.

Qualifications and Skills Required:

  • CIP / AMF License
  • 3-5 years management experience
  • 5-10 years of company underwriting experience preferred (commercial and/or personal)
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • Must be fully bilingual – written and spoken (English/French)
  • Sound knowledge of broker/insurance company relationships and the passion/drive to build up a book of business and team
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
  • Dynamic personality and willingness to maintain professional appearance and conduct. Ability to leave a positive impression with brokers
  • Should be a proactive self-starter with the ability to work independently
  • Strong ability to set priorities, solve problems, and be resourceful under pressure.

About Premier: 

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment. 

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc. 

How to Apply:   Interested applicants should submit their cover letter and resume outlining their qualifications to sandra.chow@premiergroup.ca . We thank all applicants in advance for their interest. However, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Premier is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: Commercial Lines Underwriter, Middle Market
description:
Who Are We?

Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That’s Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers – and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Category

Underwriting

Target Openings

1

What Is the Opportunity?

The Middle Market segment within our Business Insurance group at Travelers underwrites and markets a diverse portfolio of risks covering a specialized product range to meet the needs of mid-sized businesses. This Account Executive (AE), Middle Market role will partner with brokers to provide Commercial, Construction, Technology, Ocean Marine, Passenger Transportation coverage for new and renewal business based on customers' needs. As an AE, you are decisive, detail-oriented, and have the ability to build relationships internally and externally to drive results. Your ability to assess risk and sell our products will contribute to the profitability and success of Travelers.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the profitability, growth, and retention of an assigned book of business through thorough knowledge and understanding of Travelers risk appetite to make appropriate decisions within own underwriting authority.
  • Underwrite and skillfully negotiate customer accounts to minimize risk and maximize profitability.
  • Develop and maintain relationships with internal partners within the business unit and across the enterprise to create sales plans and identify cross-selling opportunities.
  • Develop, foster and maintain relationships with external partners by regularly meeting with brokers to market and sell Travelers products, leveraging a full range of product knowledge, with a goal of writing and retaining accounts consistent with our risk appetite.
  • Identify and capture new business opportunities using consultative marketing and sales skills.
  • Effectively develop and execute sales plans to ensure retention and new business targets are met.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Two years of relevant insurance or underwriting experience required.
  • Valid driver’s license or alternative means of transportation required.
  • Travel 10-25% of time required.

Education, Work Experience, & Knowledge

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred.
  • Bilingualism an asset.
  • Three to five years of relevant insurance or underwriting experience preferred.
  • Knowledge of property/casualty insurance products, the regulatory environment, and the local insurance market preferred.
  • Relevant experience interacting with brokers preferred.
  • Chartered Insurance Professional (CIP) or other insurance-related designation preferred.

Job Specific Technical Skills & Competencies

  • Strong financial acumen, including the ability to analyze financial statements and client’s loss history preferred.
  • Strong critical thinking skills, with the ability to proactively identify underwriting, marketing or financial challenges and analyze available information to make timely decisions in alignment with our risk appetite preferred.
  • Communication skills, with the ability to successfully negotiate with brokers preferred.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing accommodation to persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation during the recruitment or interview process we will work with you to accommodate your needs.

If you are a candidate and have specific questions regarding the physical requirements of this role, please send us an

4-ESU@travelers.com

so we may assist you.


By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information.

title: Technical Account Manager - Canada
description:
_It is our people behind life’s passions who will make the big difference. If you are interested in becoming part of a company that delivers market leading products, driving your own career and working with brands committed to active lifestyles, then you’ve found your fit._


_Have what it takes? Join us._


_PLEASE NOTE: Brunswick will never ask you to pay any money to participate in the interview process and will not require that you provide sensitive information such as credit card or bank account information._


_We have recently become aware of certain efforts by cyber criminals who are publishing and promoting fake job listings on third party websites, such as Craigslist and Indeed, by pretending to be actual Brunswick employees. To help ensure you don’t fall victim to any of those scams, never disclose sensitive information as mentioned above. All job offers will come to you via the candidate portal you create when applying to a posted position through_ _https://www.brunswick.com/careers_ _. Only after accepting an offer through this portal will you be asked for SSN and DOB. If you are ever unsure or want to ask any questions, please contact the Brunswick HR Shared Service Center at 866-278-6942 or_ _HRSharedServices@brunswick.com_ _._


Summary of Position:


This position is located in the Greater Vancouver Area, British Columbia, Canada. To provide all dealer, OEM, and retail customers with technical/service support, assistance in service, service management, customer relations/satisfaction, warranty adjustment, product performance, and installation for all Mercury and Brunswick products. This position reports to a Regional Service Manager.


Primary Duties and Responsibilities:


+ Provide service management counseling, onsite training of Mercury systems and processes.

+ Investigate, diagnose, and resolve service-related product malfunctions and issues.

+ Complete and submit reports on field-related activities as necessary.

+ Complete ongoing evaluations of all dealers and assist them with a business plan to upgrade their Mercury products, service, and profitably to provide ultimate customer satisfaction.

+ Communicate information to service, manufacturing, and quality engineering groups.

+ Perform other duties as assigned by the RSM

+ Territory account management responsibilities for:

+ Prospecting and vetting dealer applications, terminations, and non-renewals.

+ Interacting with sales and credit departments.

+ Dealer service development focusing on CSI and NPS metrics.

+ Manage career development for dealer technicians while interacting with Mercury University to promote technician advancement.

+ Facilitate new service talent to the marine industry by promoting and supporting local trade schools and high school vocational programs.

+ Assist and advise OEMs of product configuration, training, installation, and integration as required.

+ Organize site visits to provide improved dealer and OEM support.

+ Provide in-field support to Mercury Legal department for product liability, product failure lawsuits, onsite inspections, depositions, and participate as a witness.

+ Face-to-face interaction with consumers to resolve their product questions and issues.

+ Participate and assist the Marketing department with local, regional, national boat shows, tournaments, and special events as required. Some international travel is required.

+ Assist Large Vessel Support specialist team on specialty products as required.

+ Participate in in-service training. Secure and maintain Mercury University product certification within the first year of employment.


Knowledge, Skill, and Ability Requirements:


+ Thorough knowledge of Mercury products.

+ Comprehensive understanding of marine vessel systems, with a focus on electrical systems.

+ Complete understanding of customer service philosophy and procedures of the company.

+ Interpersonal skills are necessary to deal with dealers, customers, brokers, and OEM’s.

+ Effectively plan, develop, and execute product issue resolution, installation, and integration in the field.

+ Willingness to travel (50% - 75%) Occasional multi-week travel events may be required.

+ Ability to work independently, make accurate decisions, and analyze risk.

+ Excellent interpersonal skills, meticulous data gathering capabilities.

+ Excellent Computer and technology skills, capitalizing on effective communication and documentation through digital media.

+ International travel is required; the employee must possess and maintain a valid passport and any other documentation required to travel internationally.


Education and Experience Requirements:


Minimum Qualifications:


+ 6-8 years in marine service-related capacity.

+ Diverse advanced marine Mechanical/ Electrical background.


Preferred Qualifications:


+ Associate degree in Engineering or related field (or equivalent experience)

+ 10+ years in marine service-related capacity.


_We recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond just the technical requirements of a job. If your experience is close to what you see listed here, please still consider applying. Diversity of experience and skills combined with passion is a key to innovation and inspiration. Therefore, we encourage people from all backgrounds to apply to our positions. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the interview process._


Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled


EEO is The Law - click here (https://www.eeoc.gov/employees-job-applicants) for more information

title: Claims Examiner
description:
:

Responsibilities:

  • Working as a Third Party Administrator in the investigation, analysis, and direct oversight of full case load of nationwide first party property, liability and inland marine claims, with the opportunity to expand responsibilities into other lines of business.
  • Target identification of subrogation opportunities and lead recovery efforts.
  • Review independent adjuster reports for accuracy, and direct the investigation of your claims.
  • Promptly communicate with Lloydâ€™s of London brokers and underwriting and claims personnel of other Carrier clients to provide outstanding customer service and results.
  • Promptly communicate with insureds, claimants, retail agents, general agents, independent adjusters and attorneys as necessary. Strategize and take action to obtain best possible results for claims.
  • This position requires a high degree of knowledge with regard to all aspects of first and third party coverage.
  • Must be able to review insurance policy coverage, and prepare reservation of rights or declination letters when appropriate.
  • Be an organized, effective communicator, and possess excellent analytical, writing, negotiation, and follow-up skills
Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education
  • Ability to read, understand, and apply policy terms
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of first-party property and third-party liability adjusting experience
  • Third party adjusting experience an advantage
  • Insurance designations and commitment to ongoing insurance education preferred
  • Exemplary customer service
  • Ability to accurately handle a full case load in a fast paced environment
  • Ability and willingness to commit to extended schedules following significant catastrophe losses
  • Outstanding organizational skills and maintenance of diary system
  • Competence in using MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook and the ability to learn new IT applications such as carrier or TPA systems

The Ideal Candidate:

  • Youâ€™re organized and a master multi-tasker. You are attentive to detail and can effectively manage your time and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • Youâ€™re analytical. You connect the dots and apply what you learned to solve problems.
  • You take initiative. You donâ€™t wait until you are told what to do. You anticipate project needs and are resourceful in getting the required information to get your job done.
  • Youâ€™re a collaborative and business savvy individual willing to work across business units with a variety of stakeholders, demonstrating curiosity to learn beyond your own function.
  • Youâ€™re a team-player. Our office has a collaborative atmosphere where learning from others and teaching others is important.
  • Youâ€™re professional and client-oriented. We service clients across the globe and take pride in our professional work environment and reputation.
  • You take ownership of the success of the organization and your actions contribute directly to our growth and profitability.
About Our Company:

Kaufman Claims is a subsidiary of the H.W. Kaufman Group. Our family of companies comprises a vast network of over 50 offices across the globe. From brokerage, underwriting, premium financing and real estate to claims and loss control, together we are shaping the future of insurance.

title: Underwriter - Commercial Lines
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is one of Canada’s largest Managing Underwriting Agencies.  A leader in the Specialty Insurance industry, 100% Canadian owned. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization, our valued employees, our partners and clients.

Whether you’re starting your career or taking it to the next level, Premier offers a unique environment for you to grow & succeed. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

DEPARTMENT/LOCATION:   Commercial Lines (Spa, Health and Wellness), London or Vancouver 

POSITION:  Commercial Underwriter

Job Accountabilities:

In this position, you will underwrite and develop our Commercial portfolio, with the mandate to grow profitability, maintaining exceptional working relationships with our brokers/agents. This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise to provide support within the Commercial/Professional lines team. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve inquiries, and someone who is capable of making operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

Qualifications & Skills Required:

  • Minimum 1-3 years of company underwriting experience, handling/quoting mid-sized    Commercial accounts
  • CIP or working towards completing CIP courses
  • Good solid relationships
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • A high standard of service in handling queries
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

About Premier: 

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment. 

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc. 

How to Apply for this Position: 

Interested applicants are requested to submit their cover letter and resume outlining their qualifications to sandra.chow@premiergroup.ca . We thank all applicants in advance for their interest, please note only those under consideration will be contacted. 

Equal Opportunity Employer

Premier is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, genetic information or any other status or condition protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

title: Travel Administrator
description:
Job posting

Position: Travel Administrator (Internally known as Trip Supporter)

Location: Kamloops BC

About TRAXX

Join an industry leader and make a difference! TRAXX is a premium transportation and logistics company serving interregional communities locally and abroad. With a large fleet of motor coaches, we are equipped to get you or your team where you need to go while exceeding the industry’s safety standards and practices.

TRAXX Coachlines is a customer’s first choice for Commercial Motorcoach Services in our markets as the leaders in superior customer experiences, commitment to operational best practices in service quality, safety and security, and reliability.

In our industry TRAXX Coachlines aims to be labelled as a trusted, honest broker and high-performance tour and charter service. We will earn our customers’ enthusiasm through our continuous improvement culture driven by high integrity, exceptional teamwork, and the innovation expertise of our people.

Opportunity

We are excited to be hiring for a key member to join our Kamloops team! Our new Trip Supporter (TS) will beorganized and a natural planner. The TS will be proactively seeking and communicating all changes in the operational environment and tactically adjusting services for the trip that has been handed over from the Dispatch Coordinator. You will provide direct support to the Operator (Driver) and be the custodian of vehicle when not under the authority of an Operator.

A typical day includes the responsibilities of overseeing a new “trip”, where you will oversee both the Operator (Driver) and the motorcoach (bus). Should a driver need to leave the bus, to reposition to another trip, then you will oversee the bus at its location.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to a positive company culture and work environment
  • Provide polite and professional interactions
  • Adhere to applicable regulations & standards, including the adherence to the Duty Manager’s authority
  • Maintain proactive communication with your Operators, other Trip Supporters, and Dispatch Coordinators
  • Continually obtains information from resources on maintenance status, weather, road conditions, location capabilities and route assessments
  • Follow the Operations Manual and the Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
  • Respect operational control elements so that they are within regulatory compliance for the region(s) and the service type that they will perform
  • Maintain and communicate to the Operator, the situational awareness of the operational environment out to a purview of +36-hours (If trip is less than 36-hours, then the duration of the trip.)
  • Assist the Operator with their journey management plan and vehicle service requests while keeping the Duty Manager updated
  • Be aware of the TS’s role in the safety and quality programs, including how hazards are identified, reported, and mitigated
  • Perform duties associated with the Emergency Response Plan, i.e., assisting the DM with response
  • Education and Experience:
  • High school graduation, or equivalent
  • Experience and/or training as a Concierge, Trip Support, Travel Coordinator, Travel Agent, Logistician, or Dispatcher an asset; (this can be in any industry, such as rail, marine, freight, travel, etc.)

Qualifications and Competencies:

  • Strong decision-making skills
  • Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills
  • Strong PC skills to include the use of MS Office

Work Remotely

  • No

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $23.00-$27.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Holidays
  • Overtime
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • travel agent or travel planning: 3 years (preferred)
  • Dispatching: 2 years (preferred)
Show more

title: Financial Controller
description:
The Briere Group of companies is looking to hire an exceptional Controller. As the Controller you will join a dynamic and passionate team where you will be empowered to do your best work in an exciting environment with a high-growth team.

About the Briere Group of Companies

The Briere Group of Companies currently serve the Live Events and the Supply Chain & Logistics sectors throughout North America.

Briere Production Group is a Premier Audio, Lighting, Video and Transportation company serving clients throughout North America.

Briere Transportation Ltd is a Canadian asset-based division providing Production Transportation and General Freight Services throughout North America. Briere Transportation USA Inc. is a US based division providing services with assets based in Washington.

About the Role:
As Controller, your laser-focus is the accuracy of financial reporting and the integrity of its internal controls. You are excited to be hands-on with our customers, vendors, sales, operations, and executive teams, and you will have the rare opportunity to build financial processes and reporting from the ground-up. Most of all, you relish your role as Teammate, Leader, and Coach and you are looking for the chance to build your career and grow with a dynamic team.

About You:
You are people-focused and detail-oriented. You enjoy problem solving and thinking outside the box, but you understand the importance of good processes and you enjoy helping build and refine them. You are committed, tenacious, curious and conscientious but most of all, you love to win as part of a team. You have a CPA designation in good standing and a minimum five years of progressive accounting experience. You have strong knowledge of accounting principles, concepts, internal controls and are proficient with Quickbooks accounting and Office 365 software.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage, monitor and streamline accounting operations, including A/R, A/P, accounting and financial reporting
  • Assisting cash management processes, including cash flow projections and online banking
  • Coordinate an effective, efficient and timely month-end close process, including ownership of the general ledger, preparation of variance analysis and other relevant reporting insights
  • Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements, including preparation of supporting schedules, drafting notes as required
  • Prepare technical accounting analysis on non-standard transactions and new accounting pronouncements, including impact on existing processes and systems
  • Prepare and review monthly, quarterly, and annual accounting working papers and supporting schedules
  • Manage all aspects of the financial audit
  • Ensure CRA information returns and tax payments are filed by due dates
  • Prepare and attend to government audits, ie. CRA, WCB
  • Liaison with banks for credit review and periodic compliance reporting
  • Manage accounting system and files including being an active participant in the enhancement, maintenance and optimization of finance systems strategy and integrations
  • Establish and enhance formal processes for internal controls
  • Provide leadership to the Finance team, focusing on continual performance improvement, staff development and succession planning
  • Support cross-functional initiatives by assisting in the design and implementation of related financial processes
  • Review and approve employee expenses in accordance with the company policy
  • Enthusiastically perform other duties as required.

Administrative Duties:

  • Create, review and update company policies, employee handbook, workplace rules with reference to local laws and regulations and major customer’s requirements.
  • Review Company’s property and liability insurance, Cargo Insurance, marine cargo insurance and liaison with insurance brokers for annual renewal.
  • Review Employee Benefits (extended health & dental) programs with insurance broker for annual renewal.

Capabilities + Experience Required:

  • CPA Designation;
  • 5+ years of progressive accounting experience
  • Experience as a people manager
  • Rockstar work ethic and attitude in a fast-paced, dynamic environment;
  • Exceptional organization and communication skills
  • Attention to detail and commitment to follow-up
  • Experience working with remote execs and teams; and
  • Experience in a high-growth company is a considerable asset.

What We Offer:

  • Competitive compensation, extended benefits
  • Great people and an energetic environment
  • Coaching and professional development opportunities

Job Type: F/T – On Site

We are an equal opportunity employer and love diversity at our company! We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability status.

We thank everyone for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Please visit: www.briereproductiongroup.comto learn more about our group of companies.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $75,000.00-$90,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Paid time off
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • accounting: 4 years (required)
  • Controllers: 1 year (preferred)
Show more

title: Underwriting Assistant/ Renewal Underwriter
description:
If you are looking for an opportunity in a fast paced, motivating, hybrid work environment with great benefits, where you are empowered in your role, you may be the exact person we are looking for!

Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd. is currently seeking enthusiastic, driven individuals to join our multitalented Renewal Team as an Underwriting Assistant/Renewal Underwriter.

This position assists in the maintenance of policy renewals in collaboration with Underwriters and presents opportunities to grow within our company.

It is suitable for a candidate with prior industry experience, looking for the opportunity to work in commercial lines and learn from our established team of experts.

Due to the ongoing circumstances with the Covid-19 pandemic, you must have the ability to work from home for the foreseeable future, with the eventual expansion to a hybrid work from home/ office model.

As an Underwriting Assistant/Renewal Underwriter you will

  • Work collaboratively within a dynamic team structure alongside other Underwriting Assistants and Renewal Underwriters
  • Manage renewal business by reviewing risks and negotiating with brokers with the guidance and mentorship of underwriters
  • Reexamine exposures at renewal and work with underwriters to problem solve on challenges
  • Use company rating strategy to retain existing business, and contribute to team goals
  • Serve as the primary point of contact for assessing and quoting endorsement & cancellation requests with accuracy
  • Provide communication to the Policy Production team
  • Maintain account files and renewal records
  • Contribute to the development and strength of relationships with retail brokers

What you bring to the team:

  • Strong organization, prioritization, and time management skills to complete assignments efficiently and within structured timelines
  • An eye for detail to handle renewals and policy changes with a high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Positive, driven, and disciplined attitude
  • Solution, problem solving oriented
  • Self-motivated to meet competitive individual and team-related targets
  • Strong independent work ethic
  • Ability to work harmoniously in a team environment & collaborate with teammates
  • Strong written language, and professional communication skills
  • Flexible and adaptable to change
  • Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite
  • Level 1 General Insurance license (or the ability to obtain within a certain time frame)
  • 1+ year(s) Insurance industry experience

What SRIM has to offer:

  • A fulfilling company culture that provides personal support & mentorship, professional growth, and career advancement.
  • Bonus Structure
  • Company matched RRSP’s
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) through our parent company Brown & Brown (BRO)
  • Extended medical benefits through Canada Life
  • Continuing education and profession designation subsidy
  • A positive and collaborative environment; teammates are rewarded on their performance and achievement of goals.
  • An environment where a proactive and entrepreneurial attitude thrives

Company Background

We are an award-winning incorporated Managing General Agent (MGA) serving Canada's specialty and niche product insurance markets, offering one of the most comprehensive product lines available. Established over 20 years ago, Special Risk Insurance Managers has grown to encompass a wide range of niche and specialty products including Hard to Place Casualty & Property, High Value Residential, Sports, Leisure & Entertainment; Health & Beauty, Special Events, Inland Marine, Logging, Aviation and Marine.

Throughout our growth, we have remained true to what has enabled our success: our work culture, service to our brokers, and strong relationships with our markets.

**Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$55,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

COVID-19 considerations:
Currently we are working from home. Expanding to a hybrid in work from home/ office model with desk booking system and continued social distancing and mask protocols.

Experience:

  • insurance: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • General Insurance Level 1 (preferred)

Work remotely:

  • Temporarily due to COVID-19

title: Commercial Insurance CSR
description:
Company description

Crosbie Job Insurance Limited is the product of two long-time Newfoundland families, the Crosbies and the Jobs. The company was purchased in September 1984, by Jim Crosbie, when it was known as Job’s Insurance.

As a company that is the product of two traditional Newfoundland families, Crosbie Job has a vast background. Records indicate that the Job Brothers operated as an agent for the Royal Liverpool Insurance Company as far back as 1851, and the Crosbies’ participation in the insurance industry dates back prior to the 1900s.

Both families were initially fish merchants in St. John’s. Their operations required them to process then ship fish back to Europe. Due to the risky nature of shipping, both families perceived the need to continually obtain marine cargo insurance. These relationships lead both families to obtain general insurance markets in London. They wrote for companies such as Lloyds, Royal, etc. With their general insurance markets, both families began to write other types of insurance such as fire, liability, etc. The Crosbies have a steep history throughout Newfoundland and Canada. Jim has worked in the industry since 1959, when he began working with Holmwoods, Bach, & Manson (a Lloyds of London Broker).

He returned to Canada in 1964 to work with Crosbie, Manson & Mackinnon of Montreal. Upon his return to Newfoundland, Jim operated the Insurance Division of Crosbie Company Limited, which later became Crosbie Reed Stenhouse, then Reed Stenhouse. In 1984, Job’s Insurance was purchased and the new company became known as Crosbie Job Insurance Limited. With the purchase, Jim became President and Chief Executive Officer. Today, Jim’s son, Basil Crosbie, is our president.

Crosbie Job Insurance has a rich history in Newfoundland. We provide insurance in numerous fields such as personal, commercial, and marine insurance. We offer innovative insurance products tailored to suit our customers’ individualized needs. We specialize in difficult risks, including offshore and the Arctic Frontier. Besides St. John’s, Crosbie Job Insurance has eight Broker Representative Offices. We are responsible for 44 licensed individuals, who are available to service our clientele. We continue to search for new markets to ensure the best possible value for our customers and to be able to place those difficult risks

Job description

We are seeking an experienced Commercial Lines Customer Service Representative to join our team. Not your average customer service position! With our focus on customer service, we are always looking for new and dynamic ways to improve every aspect of our customers’ experience. Our caring staff combined with our various technology offerings give our customers the best of both worlds.

The successful candidate will have a track record for providing excellence in customer service. You use every customer interaction as an opportunity to learn more about their individual circumstance and provide thoughtful, appropriate insurance advice.
Attention to detail is a must for this role along with a willingness to be part of a collaborative team.

Responsibilities include:

  • Providing friendly and professional service to our clients
  • Respond to all incoming calls, emails and faxes
  • Reviewing Policy Renewals, endorsements and customer service on accounts through company established workflows
  • Reviewing renewals for adequacy of coverage,
  • Ensuring all policy documents are correct and processed in a timely manner
  • Dealing with Insurers and Clients regarding bonding requirements

Benefits:

  • Competitive Salary
  • Group Health & Dental
  • Long Term Disability Plan
  • Employee RRSP Matching
  • Much More

Requirements:

  • Minimum of Level 1 Property and Casualty Insurance Licence
  • Conscientious, with a strong attention to detail and high level of organization and accuracy
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proficient computer skills and working knowledge of Microsoft Office programs
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and follow-up on uncompleted tasks in a timely manner
  • Working knowledge of company portals
  • Able to work in a “paperless” environment
  • Self-starter and team player

Salary is Negotiable Based on Experience.

Crosbie Job is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity in the workplace. Individuals that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills are encouraged to apply.

On those selected for Interviews will be contacted.

Work Remotely

  • Our preference is for someone to work on site, but remote work is a possibility

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay
  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Company events
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
All team members wear a mask when moving through out the office, extra cleaning has been arranged especially to high touch surfaces. Members of the public entering our area is required to wear a mask. After clients/public leave, areas are wiped down.

title: Inventory Coordinator
description:
Headquartered in Oakville, Ontario, JF Fabrics Inc, operating for 40+ yrs., is the leading Canadian wholesaler / distributor of home Decorative Fabrics, Trim, Drapery Hardware, Wallpaper and Area Rugs.

JF sells to over 15,000 customers throughout North America. The diversified customer base includes large retailers, designers and upholsterers. As well JF serves the hospitality, marine and RV industries.

The JF Vision is to be the leader in our Industry through Reliability, Innovation and Inspiration. We succeed by engaging and enhancing our customers experience through extraordinary service, quality product and our unwavering commitment to in stock and on time delivery. Continuous improvement is a focus throughout the organization.

Looking to add to our great Team, JF Fabrics is immediately seeking an energetic and skilled

INVENTORY COORDINATOR

The successful candidate will be responsible for:

Backorders & Delivery Inquiries: Address all backorders & delivery inquiries within the allotted time, ensuring delivery dates are provided within 24 hours.

Logistics: Obtaining Spot Freight Quotes, Analysis of Freight rates with existing forwarders, establishing new freight lanes

Suppliers: Continually working to develop & nurture supplier & freight forwarder relationships.

Freight Forwarders: Coordinate with brokers & freight forwarders to ensure speedy arrival of inbound shipments.

Problem Resolution: Liaise with Customer Service and Sales Administration teams to assist with resolution to customer problems.

Purchase Orders: Issuing PO's, entering confirmations, posting in transit, receiving & releasing (as required), entering changes and cancellations. Following up with suppliers regarding updates and/or improvements.

Reporting and Analysis: Reviewing all daily reports and following through on any issues requiring attention in a timely manner. Preparing daily/weekly/monthly reports as required. Develop and maintain Inventory Procedures and Policies.

Customs: Prepare manual customs documentation for export and import.

Receiving: Coordinating with the Warehouse to address problems & discrepancies with shipments

Returns to Mills: Prepare debit notes with applicable support documentation and submit for credit to supplier for damaged goods and quality claims.

Successful Candidate Must Have the Following Skills:

Personal Skills and Abilities: Positive and confident professional demeanour; strong communications skills, both written & verbal; ability to multi-task in a well-organized manner; impeccable attention to detail; ability to prioritize and adapt to changing requirements; personable with an ability to form relationships and encourage cooperation without having the authority over such. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills

Functional Experience, Skills and Abilities: 1-2 years experience in inventory or related field; logistics etc., an asset, but not required. Must be fluent in Outlook, Excel and Word. Experience in Crystal & AS400 an asset, but not required.

Professional and Academic Credentials: Post-secondary education (College or University Degree) in Business or related field Logistics, etc.

Advantages:

Full time hours Monday to Friday 37.5 hours per week, competitive compensation package, fabulous in-house training provided.

Candidates will be subject to standard employment background check

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • On-site parking
  • Store discount

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

COVID-19 considerations:
Employees are required to perform temperature checks and complete a Covid questionnaire daily, upon entry into the building. Employees are required to submit proof of full vaccination status, unless medically exempt (proof of medical exemption required).

Experience:

  • Microsoft Office: 1 year (required)

title: Marine Charterer (Saint John, NB)
description:
Job Location: Saint John, NB
**
What you can expect in a typical day
We are looking for a Marine Charterer to ensure that appropriate vessels are chartered to meet the demands of our complex supply chain and keep our products moving. You will be responsible for chartering requirements on ships and barges including Foreign Flag, Canadian Flag, and American Flag. This includes chartering at the best possible transportation costs, management of vessel performance, and ensuring minimal risk to the company in terms of safety, reliability, financial, and meeting customer delivery expectations.

What we offer:

  • Named one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for six consecutive year
  • Competitive salary, bonus and pension plan
  • Flexible benefits plan, including a Health Spending Account
  • Wellness options including annual wellness allowance and paid personal care days
  • Paid vacation and vacation purchasing options
  • Personal and professional development opportunities

Responsibilities

  • Perform daily chartering activities for time or spot charter vessels. Coordinate delivery and redelivery notices, invoice approvals, as well as review and negotiate any post fixtures requests.
  • Work with Marine Operations to ensure the assessment and checking of claims from owners and brokers for demurrages, detention, and deviation within the terms of the charter party is done in a timely manner to negotiate prompt settlement.
  • Provide recommendations for maximizing fleet revenue and profits on spot chartered vessels.
  • Understanding of charter party terms and conditions to negotiate with Owners directly or via brokers; work towards low transportation costs per barrel (Bbl) to the company.
  • Design and execution of chartering strategies including minimizing risk exposure in schedule reliability, pollution exposure, and meeting customer delivery windows.
  • Continuously review market conditions; evaluate and recommend candidate ships and barges by considering multiple factors.
  • Coordinate with marine operations to ensure the relevant charter party terms and conditions and voyage specifics are understood by all stakeholders.
  • Support the team on the assessment and verification of claims from owners and brokers for demurrage, detention, and deviation from the terms of the charter party.
  • Provide recommendations for minimizing costs and maximizing margins.
  • Conduct analysis on chartered vessels; ensure compliance to agreed speed and consumption, that they have sufficient bunkers on board and correct controls are in place to allow the required quality of bunkers to be delivered.
  • Review non-compliance situations: ensure owners are placed on notice and lost costs are claimed back.
  • Complete monthly, quarterly, yearly, and other ad hoc reporting; manage applicable KPIs and provide shipping budget data as requested.
  • Produce market-based freight forecasts as required.

What you’ll need to succeed

  • Ability and willingness to learn.
  • Strategic mindset to understand all of the nuances and complexities of the global freight market, company standards and policies, sanction polices, and how these impact our business.
  • Knowledgeable about risks for ships in different geographic areas.
  • Strong negotiation skills.
  • Able to produce clear reports with accurate data including reports on market conditions.
  • Knowledge of marine claim procedures and settlements.
  • Financial analysis skills and acumen.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; proactive in identifying and communicating potential issues.
  • Thrive working in an ever changing, dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Able to work outside a regular office schedule as required; this is critical due to the nature of our business.

Travel

  • Occasional travel is required within our global operating areas.

Education and experience

  • Post-secondary education in business, a related field, or equivalent experience.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in ship chartering.
  • Minimum 2 years of experience in operations.
  • Strong computer skills.

Irving Oil supports a diverse and inclusive work environment and welcomes applications from all qualified applicants.

Job Type: Full-time

Show more

title: Head of Marine Canada
description:
Role Purpose:
  • Develop and execute the local strategy and proactively support the development of the global strategy for Inland as well as Ocean Marine.
  • Manage all local LoB portfolio to ensure the successful achievement of the global AGCS LoB targets
  • Manage all local LoB UW staff
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with brokers and clients

Key Responsibilities:

Lead and Manage Underwriting Team
  • Lead and manage local team, including direct reports and matrix management of functional reports
  • Manage cost center budget within plan

Underwriting Strategy
  • Develop and execute local UW strategy for line of business
  • Support the development of global Underwriting LoB strategy, in line with AGCS CUO
  • Support the development of cross LoB regional strategy, in line with R&M and Regional CEO

Steering and Controlling
  • Steer and control local line of business portfolio to drive achievement of financial targets (e.g. full combined ratio)
  • Drive underwriting planning process and monitor adherence to plan, taking corrective action as necessary
  • Proactively liaising with functional areas to review performance of end to end Underwriting life cycle

Underwriting Approach and Compliance
  • Ensure underwriting consistency and underwriting discipline and adherence to all corporate guidelines and authority levels, including Rules and Principles, Underwriting Authorities, corporate governance rules, and local regulatory framework
  • Referral / case Underwriting of key clients as required

Product Development
  • Proactively support development and implementation of new and modified products
  • Proactively support development and implementation of pricing tools
  • Maintain executive contacts and accompany the Underwriting of all core or strategic accounts

Market & Relationship Management
  • Proactively support acquisition of new business and retention of existing business (including client and broker negotiations where necessary)
  • Coordinate with local MMC to drive successful execution of strategic plan
  • Communicate local LoB strategy externally
  • Positively represent AGCS internally within the Allianz Group, and externally to the market
  • Proactively drive involvement of functional areas in Underwriting process, including e.g. MMC, ARC, Claims, Operations

Required Skills:
  • Master’s Degree, preferably in Economics, Law, or other appropriate discipline
  • 7-10 years of experience and recognized relationship building with brokers at peer group level and well established within local market
  • Expert understanding of legal and regulatory framework
  • Significant experience in leadership and development of direct teams internationally and within complex global matrix environments
  • Analyze current performance against benchmarks applying how the market operates and functions, the business needs and customer needs
  • Design, develop and implement consistent, robust wordings
  • Robust understanding of policy administration life cycle, information collection, policy issuance, premium bookings, credit control, cancellation.

Compensation is commensurate with skills and experience and includes a comprehensive best in class benefits package. Any salary or benefits information provided by third party resources such as external job posting websites etc., cannot be deemed reliable.

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.

For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.
