title: Yacht Sales Representative
description:
We are an established yacht brokerage located on Granville Island, the heart of British Columbia’s marine community. We are looking for motivated and professional commission yacht sales representatives who are experienced boaters and can confidently represent the boating lifestyle and quality sail and power boat brands.

Your role as a Yacht Broker

  • Initiate and close sales;
  • Share your experience with existing customers and prospect for new customers who want to sell or buy a boat;
  • Generate, sustain and develop long-term relationships;
  • Develop customized strategic marketing plans that build your profile and enable sales success;
  • Execute on sale & listing requirements: facilitate contract requirements, conduct sea trials and complete commissioning.
  • Uphold the standards and ethics of Specialty Yachts and that of a Certified Professional Yacht Broker (CPYB)

Experience

  • Must be a boater who can confidently handle both sailboats and powerboats.
  • 3+ years in marine industry/consumer luxury product sales.
  • Comfortable handling individual sales in the $150,000 – $2,000,000 range.
  • A resourceful self-starter.
  • Bachelor’s Degree/Business/Marketing/Sales certificate preferred.

Compensation & Benefits

  • Earnings are determined by you, dependent on experience, focus and commitment to growing portfolio.
  • Extended benefits plan.
  • Financial support for professional development plan.
  • Flexible work environment;

Please forward cover letter with your resume to info@specialty-yachts.com. We thank all applicants in advance. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Personal Lines Underwriter
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is a leader in the Specialty Insurance industry. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization and its clients. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

DEPARTMENT/LOCATION: Personal Lines, London or Vancouver
POSITION: Underwriter (Personal Lines)

Job Accountabilities:

In this position you will underwrite and service our Personal Lines business, with a mandate to grow, and to develop and maintain exceptional working relationships with our brokers/agents. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve broker inquiries, and someone who is capable of making operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

Qualifications Required:

  • Working towards or willingness to obtain CIP
  • General Insurance License; preference will be given to those with a Level 2 license
  • Minimum of 2-4 years of personal lines underwriting

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:

  • Ability to select, underwrite and manage specialized personal lines
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • Sound knowledge of broker/agent/insurance company relationships and the ability to apply this to the underwriting of an account
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

About Premier:

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products. www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment.

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc.

title: Executive Underwriter - Inland Marine - Northeast Zone & Canada
description:
Role Purpose:
  • Underwrite profitable new and renewal business to meet Inland Marine targets in accordance with underwriting guidelines and underwriting authority
  • Negotiate price and terms and conditions
  • Ownership of key accounts / clients
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with producers and clients in partnership with Market Management
  • Coach and mentor Underwriters

Key Responsibilities:

Support Underwriting Strategy:
  • Participate in the development and execution of regional Underwriting strategy for Inland Marine
  • Work closely with Market Management, Claims and other product lines to achieve key marketing strategies, including cross- selling

Underwrite Profitable business
  • Underwrite new and renewal accounts to meet top and bottom line targets
  • Negotiate price and terms and conditions with producers
  • Proactively manage capacity
  • Underwrite and evaluate Natural Catastrophe Accumulation, ensuring an understanding of catastrophe modeling and interpretation of scenarios for Inland Marine
  • Underwrite International Insurance Programs for Inland Marine

Relationship Management
  • Positively represent AGCS externally to the market
  • Proactively drive involvement of functional areas in Underwriting process, including e.g. MMC, ARC, Claims, Operations
  • Develop and maintain strong relationships with key producers and clients and other relevant stakeholders (e.g. risk managers)

Policy Documentation and Administration
  • Ensure accurate policy documentation issued to producers (where AGCS responsibility to do so) or producers has issued documentation (where producer responsibility)
  • File maintenance – ensure file is established (whether electronic or paper) and maintained for each risk and transaction handled
  • Proactively support completion of policy administration and credit control processes

Market Management:
  • Proactively support acquisition of new business and retention of existing business (including client and producer negotiations where necessary)
  • Proactively liaise with MMC on market management initiatives

Support Key Business Initiatives/Misc.:
  • Participate / contribute to key projects
  • Training and development of underwriters in Lob, e.g. Associate Underwriters and Underwriters
  • Referral point for other underwriters Participate in cross regional activities as required / requested

Required Skills:
  • Preferably degree in Economics, Finance, Insurance Management, or Business Administration
  • Proven track record in Underwriting profitable business in Inland Marine with 11 plus years' experience
  • In depth understanding of Inland Marine products and portfolio
  • In depth understanding of regional / local Inland Marine insurance markets and competitor landscape
  • Demonstrable, established relationships with brokers at peer group level and well established within local market
  • Ability to assess risk inherent exposures and natural hazards relevant to Inland Marine
  • Manage the underwriting books. Analyze trends and scenario plans from which portfolio strategies can be developed and implemented
  • Analyze current performance against various benchmarks with a view to ensure adequate progress and satisfactory performance
  • Apply the knowledge of how the market operates and functions, the business needs and customer needs
  • Completion of professional insurance qualification (e.g. CII)

Compensation is commensurate with skills and experience and includes a comprehensive best in class benefits package. Any salary or benefits information provided by third party resources such as external job posting websites etc., cannot be deemed reliable.

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us. Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

Allianz Global Corporate & Specialty (AGCS) is a leading global corporate insurance carrier and a key business unit of Allianz Group. We provide risk consultancy, Property-Casualty insurance solutions and alternative risk transfer for a wide spectrum of commercial, corporate and specialty risks across 10 dedicated lines of business.
Our customers are as diverse as business can be, ranging from Fortune Global 500 companies to small businesses, and private individuals. Among them are not only the world’s largest consumer brands, tech companies and the global aviation and shipping industry, but also wineries, satellite operators or Hollywood film productions. They all look to AGCS for smart answers to their largest and most complex risks in a dynamic, multinational business environment and trust us to deliver an outstanding claims experience.

Worldwide, AGCS operates with its own teams in 32 countries and through the Allianz Group network and partners in over 200 countries and territories, employing over 4,300 people. As one of the largest Property-Casualty units of Allianz Group, we are backed by strong and stable financial ratings. In 2019, AGCS generated a total of €9.1 billion gross premium globally.

For more information, visit www.agcs.allianz.com or follow us on Twitter @AGCS_Insurance and LinkedIn.

title: Underwriting Assistant
description:
APRIL Canada is the leading wholesale broker of niche property and casualty insurance products in Canada. The market segments served in Canada are Construction Contractors, Motor Truck Cargo, Realty, Vacant, Third Party Liability for Manufacturers and Wholesalers, Standard and Specialized Errors and Omissions, Personal and Commercial Automobiles, Freight Transportation, Housing, Pleasure Marine and Commercial Marine. In Canada, the April Group has more than 1,500 insurance broker clients and more than 100 employees.

We are currently seeking for an UNDERWRITING ASSISTANT for our Toronto office. The candidate will support the Underwriters in their day to day tasks. We are looking for someone that would be embedded in our values: building trust, pushing boundaries, innovating and keeping things simple.

Your mission in few words:

  • Assist the underwriter with the endorsements, renewals and new business
  • Deal with brokers in writing, by telephone or electronic mail
  • Issuing policies and billing accounts
  • Performs clerical duties
  • Maintain positive broker relations

Qualifications & personality we are looking for:

  • 0-2 years’ experience as Underwriting Assistant
  • Strong organisational skills
  • Professional, positive and courteous in all interactions, with customers and co-workers
  • Performs well in a busy operation and remains calm under pressure
  • Team player adaptable to a changing environment
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications. Knowledge of Policy works would be an asset
  • Personable and energetic

At APRIL, we live our values every day. Here are those that will make you feel good about working with us

  • People are at the heart of everything we do. We trust our employees.
  • Team spirit is very important. We help and respect each other. The strengths of one person make up for the weaknesses of the other. When one of us wins, we all win.
  • Intrapreneurship is strongly encouraged. Positions are defined by the employees.
  • We challenge the way we do things to go further.
  • We have an open door policy: managers are always listening and cooperation between teams is encouraged.

Working at APRIL pays off
Recognized as one of the best employers in the insurance industry by Top insurance workplace 2021, we offer our employees a wide range of benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible working hours (35 hours per week) as well as telecommuting opportunities Work/family balance at the heart of the company's model.
  • 3 weeks of vacation from the 1st year as well as 5 floating vacations per year, and a day offered for your birthday!
  • New, colorful, open-plan offices
  • Business casual dress code
  • Competitive benefits program, including group insurance, employee assistance program and telemedicine for employees and their families
  • Savings incentive (group RRSP, 2.5% employer participation)
  • Profit sharing program for all employees from the first year
  • Continuous training offer, possibility of employer-paid training
  • Equipment in the office as at home

If you are interested by this opportunity, please send your resume !!! We look forward to speak with you!

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vision
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Horaires flexibles
  • Programme d'Aide aux Employés
  • Programmes de Bien-être
  • REER Collectif
  • Régime de retraite
  • Régimes de participation aux bénéfices
  • Stationnement sur place
  • Tenue Décontractée
  • Travail à Distance

Horaire :

  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Quart de jour
  • Repos la fin de semaine

Rémunération supplémentaire :

  • Primes

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Attention RIBO Licensed Brokers with min. 3 years’ Customer Service Representative experience

A Great Position Is Now Open

Do you work for an old-fashioned broker with ancient technology? Are they falling behind the best industry practices instead of growing? At Levitt our technology is outstanding in our industry.

Do you work for a family-owned agency with bleak prospects to advance into management and leadership? At Levitt we expect our brokers to advance and we support that end goal.

Are your coworkers dragging you down and creating a negative environment? At Levitt we enjoy a healthy and fun work environment.


We Have Magnetized our Business to Attract Talent:

  • Increased the base compensation for this role by 15% -20%.
  • Introduced a Group Benefits plan
  • Started a retirement savings plan
  • Brought in 5 additional insurance companies to have a wide product range to sell from and be more competitive
  • Created a corporate culture where fun is encouraged and where excellent contributions are recognized
  • Invested in technology to the point where we won a CSIO Technology Leader award in 2017
  • Invested in marketing – now we are a top-rated broker in our main operational area of Greater Toronto
  • We have been honored with the 2018 Elite Broker Award by Insurance Business Canada


We Provide:

  • The latest technology – to capture prospects’ information, service accounts, quote and process policies in minutes
  • A chance to advance into management – we’ve been growing
  • Set hours, with the potential to work some hours from home
  • A base salary of $47,000 to $52,000 – plus bonuses, health coverage, paid vacation days, etc.


We Support You By:

  • Providing you many insurance companies so you can service customers better
  • By showing you appreciation – for being a valuable member of our winning team
  • Investing in the latest technology
  • Maintaining an energetic, active and strong web presence, every day


Our Work Environment:

  • Is stimulating and fun because we are growing
  • Is balanced with our brokers’ personal lives
  • Offers flexible work schedules where possible
  • Puts you in a position that allows you to earn much more money than you are currently earning
  • Creates the opportunity for you to achieve the great things that you are capable of
  • Will let you create your own career path within a fast-growing organization


The Job Description:

This is a customer service role. You will enjoy our team meetings, growth sessions and ongoing training classes so you can learn more, earn more, and contribute your ideas to the rest of your team members.

Your work will focus on 4 main lines of business: home insurance, tenant insurance, auto insurance and motorcycle insurance. There could be exposure to commercial insurance in the future.

Our new customers approach us online, call in or visit our office. Your role as a RIBO Customer Service Representative is key in our organization because we have high aspirations. We are working hard to become a major insurance broker in Ontario.

Our current staff came to work for us and stayed for years, for good reasons. We are a business that delivers stability and prosperity.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Provide customers with exceptional service and an excellent experience every time
  • Answer customers’ questions and address concerns
  • Prepare insurance quotes and sell, upsell and/or cross sell insurance policies
  • Prepare and review renewals with customers and remarket policies as required
  • Connect with insurers and underwriters to discuss and submit risks
  • Upload new business and process policy changes and endorsements on company portals
  • Assist and provide support to producers when required
  • Document claims information on files
  • Report and follow up on claims on behalf of customers
  • Other sales or service projects as required


The Opportunity for Growth (Really Does Exist Here):

You will be joining a growing organization, at the right time in our growth curve, to allow you to shape your career and advance rapidly.

We are looking to attract exceptional brokers that love the opportunity to take on broader and more meaningful assignments and manage their careers. We want you to contribute ideas and energy to the growth of an award-winning organization.

Are you energetic, passionate, dynamic and love learning? Are you committed about advancing in your career as a broker? Then this could be the opportunity you have been waiting for.

The Latest Technology Awaits You:

We believe that you need the best tools to work with. That’s why technology adoption is an intrinsic part of our success. Our investment in the latest cutting-edge technology resulted in a CSIO Technology Leader award in 2017.

What It Takes – You Have to Be Able To:

  • Prepare accurate quotes by using the Applied Rating Services (Compuquote) software
  • Accurately read and interpret Hits, MVR and Autoplus reports
  • Enjoy providing customer service and helping customers
  • Connect with insurers and underwriters to discuss auto insurance and home insurance risks. Exposure to specialty insurance (e.g. marine insurance) is minimal
  • Be a ‘Go-Getter’ and maintain a positive “Can Do” attitude


You Need:

  • RIBO license is a must, CAIB and/or CIP is a bonus
  • Min 3-5 years Customer Service experience within an insurance brokerage
  • Good working knowledge of personal lines insurance policies and coverages
  • Proficient in the use of Applied Rating (CompuQuote), able to quote independently both home and auto risks
  • Proficient in the use of a Broker Management System (ideally Power Broker)
  • Good working knowledge of several insurance company portals such us Intact, Aviva, RSA, Economical, Travelers, Chieftain, Pembridge, Echelon, Perth, Jevco etc.
  • Skilled in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel)
  • Dedicated team player with a strong work ethic and desire to achieve
  • Very strong attention to detail
  • Strong multi-tasking and time management skills
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
  • Prior work on Commercial Lines risks is an asset


We Offer You:

  • A convenient office location. Our office is easily accessible.
  • A Group Benefits package that gives you peace of mind.
  • Retirement Savings Plan contributions are available to select positions within the organization.


About Us:

We have been honored with the 2018 Elite Broker Award by Insurance Business Canada.

We are an ideal insurance brokerage for a customer service representative who is looking for a career, not just a job, and has at least 3 years’ experience. We are not looking for beginners.

This is a customer service role. We are an established brokerage that has invested a lot in technology. We deal with top insurers in the country and have high growth aspirations. Our staff is mature with many years of experience and can provide guidance and support to your career. Some will retire soon, creating opportunities for you to move into a leadership role.

Thus, this is the perfect timing for a career-oriented customer service representative who is looking for rapid advancement into a management role.

We offer a career with a brokerage that is growing and has high aspirations. We need team players that want to be part of, and contribute to, a winning organization. Many insurance companies believe in us and our growth plans.

We have more than tripled our marketing budget in the last 2 years and will continue to increase the marketing spend. It pays.

We are looking for winners who want to be part of a great company. Can you help us achieve 10x volume in the next 5-10 years? Let’s talk.


Are You Interested, But Not Sure If the Fit is Right?

Roles that we consider as valuable prior experience are:

  • Insurance Broker – CSR
  • Insurance Broker, Account Manager
  • Personal Lines Insurance Broker
  • Personal Lines Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Customer Service
  • Sales Insurance Advisor
  • RIBO Licensed Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Sales Representative CSR
  • Client Manager Personal Lines, Registered Insurance Broker
  • Underwriter or Junior Underwriter.
  • Technical Service Representative, TSR, Personal Lines TSR
  • Junior Broker, Client Advocate, Associate Insurance Advisor


This is a full-time job.

To apply now, email your application to careers@levitt.ca

Like the work, love the career? Call us!

title: Sales Administration Manager
description:
About Townline


The Townline Group is a Real Estate Development Company primarily focused in the Lower Mainland and Vancouver Island. Our development and construction portfolios are diverse and consist of mixed-used multi-family and commercial construction, as well as non-market and purpose-built rental housing. Townline is a well-rounded company with proven teams specialized in the areas of Development, Affordable Housing, Finance, Acquisitions, Construction, Sales, Marketing and Customer Care all housed under one roof. Townline has been building homes since 1981 and believe diversity is the cornerstone to our success and longevity.


Townline offers ample opportunities for growth and development, a competitive compensation package, a comprehensive health benefits program and an on-site gym/wellness centre. As well, our office is conveniently located right on the Canada Line at Marine Gateway. This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is looking for experience in the rewarding field of social-purpose housing development and with one of BC's most respected and proven developers.


Currently we are in need of a dedicated Sales Administration Coordinator to join the team at our Head Office in Vancouver, BC! This is an ideal opportunity for an individual that has previous experience at Sales Presentation Centres.


Responsibilities


  • Providing presentation center administration support for the sales launches of new projects.
  • Working closely with the Sales and Marketing team for Sales Presentation Center set up and closing to facilitate administration needs.
  • Facilitate the training, tracking, reporting of FINTRAC to the FINTRAC Compliance Officer
  • Assisting with the ongoing management of Townline Marketing Inc. real estate council requirements
  • Creating and maintaining master excel spreadsheets regarding Sales Projects.
  • Maintain and updating all agreement related documents through the life cycle of every Sales Project
  • Responsible for facilitating Purchaser correspondence and maintaining a high level of customer service.
  • Facilitate the tracking of but not limited to Sales, Purchase and Sale Agreements, Amendments, Incentives, Deposits, Mortgages, Broker Referrals, Lawyers' Information,
  • Create, maintain and update Purchaser Files
  • Tracking staff pay and timesheets
  • Providing training, mentorship and guidance to Sales Administration team.
  • Oversee and administer tasks to ensure the operation of the Sales Presentation Centre runs efficiently
  • Maintain relationships with Purchasers, Brokers, agents
  • Provide reporting on project and sales updates
  • Working with the Sales team to resolve purchaser issues
  • Working closely with the Customer Care Team to release home owner keys.
  • Responsible for ordering and inventory of supplies for set up and maintenance of the Presentation Centre
  • Other duties and projects as assigned

Skills and Requirements


  • 3-5 years of work experience at Sales Presentation Centre or real estate related experience;
  • Relator license is an asset bot not required;
  • Ability to take direction from multiple sources;
  • A strong work ethic, attention to detail and excellent organizational skills;
  • Ability to handle a substantial workload, multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project etc.);
  • Proficiency with the Avesdo Platform, Lasso or equivalent CRM system is preferred;
  • Possess a reliable vehicle and valid drivers’ license;
  • Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing;
  • A willingness to ask questions and find solutions

If you don't meet all the requirements listed, we still encourage you to apply, as we're still eager to meet individuals who are aligned with Townline's core values and can contribute in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes. Townline is all about the Team, and we take pride in providing a work environment where people grow, evolve, and feel appreciated.


Successful candidate will be required to provide official documentation confirming receipt of two (2) doses of a COVID-19 vaccine, as recognized for use in Canada, prior to starting employment. Continued employment will be conditional on receiving, and providing confirmation of, any additional “booster” vaccine doses, as recommended by the Ministry of Health & Provincial Health Officer. Exceptions based on medical, religious or other valid grounds will be considered on a case by case basis.

Show more

title: Junior Insurance Broker
description:
Attention RIBO Insurance Broker with 2-5 years’ experience

A Great Position Is Now Open

Have you just received your license but are not being recognized for it in your current job? At Levitt we want you to become a seasoned, successful broker here at Levitt in 1-2 years.

Do you work for an old-fashioned broker with ancient technology? Are they falling behind the best industry practices instead of growing? At Levitt our technology is outstanding in our industry.

Do you work for a family-owned agency with bleak prospects to advance into management and leadership? At Levitt we expect our brokers to advance and we support that end goal.

Are your coworkers dragging you down and creating a negative environment? At Levitt we enjoy a healthy and fun work environment.

We Have Magnetized our Business to Attract Talent:

  • Increased the base compensation for this role by 20% -25%.
  • Introduced a Group Benefits plan
  • Started a retirement savings plan
  • Brought in 5 additional insurance companies to have a wide product range to sell from and be more competitive
  • Created a corporate culture where fun is encouraged and where excellent contributions are recognized
  • Invested in technology to the point where we won a CSIO Technology Leader award in 2017
  • Invested in marketing – now we are a top-rated broker in our main operational area of Greater Toronto
  • We have been honored with the 2018 Elite Broker Award by Insurance Business Canada


We Provide:

  • The latest technology – to quickly capture every prospects’ information, accurately quote and then process new business in minutes
  • A chance to advance into management – we’ve been growing
  • Set hours, with the potential to work some hours from home
  • A base salary of $47,000 to $50,000 – plus bonuses, health coverage, paid vacation days, etc.


We Support You By:

  • Mentoring, coaching and training you, on an ongoing basis, to help you develop your career in insurance
  • By showing you appreciation – for being a valuable member of our winning team
  • Investing in the latest technology
  • Maintaining an energetic, active and strong web presence, every day


Our Work Environment:

  • Is stimulating and fun because we are growing
  • Is balanced with our brokers’ personal lives
  • Offers flexible work schedules where possible
  • Puts you in a position that allows you to earn much more money than you are currently earning
  • Creates the opportunity for you to achieve the great things that you are capable of
  • Will let you create your own career path within a fast-growing organization


The Job Description:

This is a support role. You will enjoy our team meetings, growth sessions and ongoing training classes so you can learn more, earn more, and contribute your ideas to help us grow more.

Your work will focus on 4 main lines of business: home insurance, tenant insurance, auto insurance and motorcycle insurance. This is not a commercial insurance broker position, although there could be exposure to commercial insurance in the future.

Our new customers approach us online, call in or visit our office. Your role as a RIBO Junior Insurance Broker is key in our organization because we have high aspirations. We are working hard to become a major insurance broker in Ontario.

Our current staff came to work for us and stayed for years, for good reasons. We are a business that delivers stability and prosperity.

Primary responsibilities include:

  • Provide an exceptional customer experience at every interaction
  • Support the sales and service functions (uploading policies on insurance company portals, providing quotations to customers and brokers, etc.)
  • Process renewals and endorsements on company portals
  • Set up pre-authorized payments and send payment reminders when necessary
  • Document claims information on files
  • Issue Temporary Liability Cards and Insurance Certificates for customers
  • Know, understand and be ready to learn some of our current insurance companies’ portals including: Intact, Aviva, RSA, Economical, Travelers, Chieftain, Pembridge, Echelon, Perth, Jevco among others.
  • Office administration – some administrative tasks include: eDocs download, reconciliations, mailings, etc.
  • Able to take on other tasks as necessary


The Opportunity for Growth (Really Does Exist Here):

You will be joining an organization at the right time in our growth curve, to allow you to shape your career and advance rapidly.

We are looking to attract exceptional younger brokers that love the opportunity to take on broader and more meaningful assignments earlier in their careers. We want you to contribute ideas and energy to our award-winning organization.

Are you energetic, passionate, dynamic and love learning? Are you committed about advancing in your career as a broker? Then this could be the opportunity you have been waiting for.


The Latest Technology Awaits You:

We believe that you need the best tools to work with. That’s why technology adoption is an intrinsic part of our success. Our investment in the latest cutting-edge technology resulted in a CSIO Technology Leader award in 2017.

What It Takes – You Have to Be Able To:

  • Prepare accurate quotes by using the Applied Rating Services (Compuquote) software
  • Accurately read and interpret Hits, MVR and Autoplus reports
  • Provide sales support – follow up on leads
  • Enjoy the sales process and its challenges
  • Enjoy providing customer service and helping customers
  • Connect with insurers and underwriters to submit and process auto insurance and home insurance risks. Exposure to specialty insurance (e.g. marine insurance) is minimal
  • Be a ‘Go-Getter’ and maintain a positive “Can Do” attitude


You Need:

  • A RIBO license. Working towards CAIB and/or CIP is a bonus
  • Recent experience (2 years to 5 years) as a TSR, Insurance Customer Service Representative, Insurance Broker, or Junior Underwriter
  • Experience with uploading new business in several insurance company portals, like Intact, Aviva, RSA, Economical, Travelers, Chieftain, Pembridge, Echelon, Perth, Jevco and Pafco
  • Prior experience working with Power Broker or any other broker management system (e.g. TAM, Epic, SigXP)
  • Basic skills in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel
  • Very strong attention to detail
  • Strong multi-tasking and time management skills
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
  • Confidence in your ability to process policy changes, support the Service and Sales teams
  • A love for learning new ways of doing things
  • Enthusiasm for dealing with people and helping them get what they need


We Offer You:

  • A convenient office location. Our office is easily accessible.
  • A Group Benefits package that gives you peace of mind.
  • Retirement Savings Plan contributions are available to select positions within the organization.


About Us:

We have been honored with the 2018 Elite Broker Award by Insurance Business Canada.

Our established brokerage is ideally situated for a career-oriented younger broker with 2-5 years of experience who is looking for rapid advancement into a management role.

Many insurance companies believe in us and in our growth plans. We have invested a lot in technology. We deal with top insurers in the country and have high aspirations. We have more than tripled our marketing budget in the last 2 years and will continue to increase the marketing spend. It pays.

This is a support role. We are not looking for beginners. Our staff is mature with many years of experience and can provide guidance and support to your career. Some will retire soon, creating opportunities for you to move into a leadership role. We need team players that want to be part of, and contribute to, a winning organization.

We are looking for winners who want to be part of a great company. Can you help us achieve 10x volume in the next 5-10 years? Let’s talk.


Are You Interested, But Not Sure If the Fit is Right?

Roles that we consider as valuable prior experience are:

  • Technical Service Representative, TSR, Personal Lines TSR
  • Junior Broker, Client Advocate, Associate Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Broker, Account Manager
  • Personal Lines Insurance Broker
  • Personal Lines Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Customer Service
  • Sales Insurance Advisor
  • RIBO Licensed Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Sales Representative CSR
  • Client Manager Personal Lines, Registered Insurance Broker
  • Underwriter or Junior Underwriter.


This is a full-time job.

Required experience: RIBO license with 2-5 years’ experience.

To apply now, email your application to careers@levitt.ca


Like the work, love the career? Call us!

title: Program Coordinator
description:
RedHawk Survival Training Institute aims to be Canada's leading survival training provider and emergency preparedness service. Our services are invaluable to major industries including oil companies, airports, land waste site, historical sites, construction sites, private sectors, schools, businesses and other corporations. We also provide the best emergency disaster kits that money can buy - and the training that goes with them to keep yourself and your family or business safe.

Our vision is that everyone will be protected by our high quality PPE and have access to our kits, Hovercraft, Ecodomes, and other emergency shelters. Our aim is to keep you safe and healthy. We prepare you for every emergency, both natural and man-made!

We offer expertly designed workplace, wilderness and marine survival and emergency disaster courses. There are many reasons for wanting to learn both workplace and wilderness survival skills. Reasons vary from the desire to develop a real connection to the natural world to wanting to be prepared for a natural or man-made disaster.

RedHawk as (4) opening part time/full time positions for Program Coordinators for our Survival Training Courses - Travel & Adventure Programs- Newfoundland- Canada-USA-UK-EU- Worldwide.

Our survival training, travel and adventure courses and programs are offered at our remote site facility outside of Marystown, Newfoundland, Canada.

Requirements for these positions:

Minimum of 10 year’s experience as a certified Program Coordinator in both, workplace training & travel & adventure industries.

Minimum of 5 years working directly with worldwide travel companies-agents and operators- travel insurance brokers and corporations is essential

Degree or certificates in Business Management- Educational Program Management

Must have a good understanding for required training in various sectors and industries, including insurance policy requirements, governing acts and laws.

Registering and coordinating corporate and government teams and groups for training, supplies and travel from (25) to (10,000) workers- individuals and travel groups annually is required.

Extensive workplace travel across Canada and around the world.

Knowledgeable and experienced in the office and field in natural and man-made disasters and response is an Absolute Must

Willing to travel if/when required/ willing to work from office/ home and our remote training facility/sites.

All experience and certified candidates can forward your resumes-cvs, a photo, along with 3 references

An up to date Passport, Canadian Driver’s License, and Criminal Record Check is also required

You may also take a look at our website for more information about RedHawk and our services and programs we offer at www.redhawksurvival.com or check out our YouTube video at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=shj9Pd_KIWM

Prepare Today, For Confidence In Tomorrow!

Thank you for your interest, Stay Safe Everyone.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Fixed term contract
Contract length: 12 months

Pay: $25.00-$28.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift

Education:

  • Master's Degree (preferred)

Experience:

  • Program management: 10 years (required)

Application deadline: 2022-03-15

Show more

title: Commercial Lines Underwriter (Spa, Health and Wellness)
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is one of Canada’s largest Managing Underwriting Agencies. A leader in the Specialty Insurance industry, 100% Canadian owned. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization, our valued employees, our partners and clients.

Whether you’re starting your career or taking it to the next level, Premier offers a unique environment for you to grow & succeed. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

DEPARTMENT/LOCATION: Commercial Lines (Spa, Health and Wellness), London or Vancouver
POSITION: Commercial Underwriter

Job Accountabilities:

In this position, you will underwrite and develop our Commercial portfolio, with the mandate to grow profitability, maintaining exceptional working relationships with our brokers/agents. This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise to provide support within the Commercial/Professional lines team. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve broker/agent inquiries, and someone who is capable of making operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

Qualifications & Skills Required:

  • Minimum 1-3 years of company underwriting experience, handling/quoting mid-sized Commercial accounts
  • CIP or working towards completing CIP courses
  • Good solid relationships
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • A high standard of service in handling queries
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

About Premier:

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products. www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment.

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc.

title: Director – Laval, QC
description:
PREMIER (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is a leader in the Specialty Insurance industry. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization and its clients. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

Position: Director – Quebec, Laval

We are looking for someone who will lead our growing Quebec region into the future. We need a dynamic individual who can leverage all of our existing resources and talent to help us expand. Do you have the drive and the leadership experience to take this exciting role on? If you do, then we have a great position for you to work in a professional agile dynamic environment with a competitive compensation plan.

Job accountabilities will include:

In this position for our Branch Office in Laval (with the assistance of the Executive Team) you will play a critical part in enhancing and developing Premier’s reputation with Quebec broker/agent force. Simultaneously you will also be responsible for building the team as the portfolio of business continues to expand for the Quebec region.

This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve broker/agent inquiries, and someone who is capable of making leadership and operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

  • Working with Executive for broker/agent relationship building, creating promotional material for the benefit of both internal teams and external brokers/agents. Assisting with presenting/attending/creating Broker/Agent Seminars.
  • Lead and continue to develop all underwriting teams working with our Underwriting Leadership Team across Canada. Establish and promote a team environment based on high trust and performance Ensuring alignment of individual roles and performance with our business model.
  • Working with Claims Team on emerging claims issues and loss experience/trends.

Qualifications and Skills Required:

  • CIP / AMF License
  • 3-5 years management experience
  • 5-10 years of company underwriting experience preferred (commercial and/or personal)
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • Must be fully bilingual – written and spoken (English/French))
  • Sound knowledge of broker/agent/insurance company relationships and the passion/drive to build up a book of business and team
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
  • Dynamic personality and willingness to maintain professional appearance and conduct. Ability to leave a positive impression with brokers/agents
  • Should be a proactive self-starter with the ability to work independently
  • Strong ability to set priorities, solve problems, and be resourceful under pressure

About Premier:

Founded in 1989, Premier is Head quartered in Vancouver, with branch locations in Toronto, London, Cambridge and Laval. With over 150 employees, Premier includes Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and the various specialty insurance products we offer - www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you launch a career. We work with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic and fast paced environment.

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional medical, dental, and vision care; life insurance; etc.

title: Insurance Broker
description:
Attention Successful RIBO Insurance Broker

A Great Position Is Now Open


Low quality leads got you down? Long hours at work with little or no base pay? That’s not good.

Are you struggling on a commission-heavy pay plan, living paycheck to paycheck? That’s no life for a skilled insurance agent.

Do you work for an old-fashioned broker with ancient technology? Are they falling behind the best industry practices instead of growing? You can’t grow much there.

Do you work for a family-owned agency with bleak prospects to advance into management and leadership? There’s no future in that.

Are your coworkers dragging you down and creating a negative environment? You deserve better.


We Provide:

  • Fresh leads to you – every day
  • Set hours, with the future chance to work some hours from home
  • The latest technology – to quickly capture every prospects’ information, accurately quote and then write new business, fast and efficiently
  • A chance to advance into management – we’ve been growing
  • A base salary of $47,000 to $52,000 – plus bonuses


We Support You By:

  • Mentoring, coaching and training you, on an ongoing basis, to help you develop your career in insurance sales
  • By showing you appreciation – for being a valuable member of our winning team
  • Investing in the latest technology
  • Maintaining an energetic, active and strong web presence, to bring you high-quality clients, every day


Our Work Environment:

  • Is stimulating and fun because we are growing
  • Is balanced with our agents’ personal lives
  • Offers flexible work schedules where possible as well as the future opportunity to work some hours from home. We have the technology for that.
  • Puts you in a position that allows you to earn much more money than you are currently earning
  • Creates the opportunity for you to achieve the great things that you are capable of
  • Will let you create your own career path within a fast-growing organization


The Job Description:

This is inside sales. As a RIBO licensed agent you will sell personal lines insurance to new customers. You will enjoy our team meetings, growth sessions and ongoing training classes so you can learn more, earn more, and contribute your ideas to the rest of your team members.

Your work will focus on 4 main lines of business: home insurance, tenant insurance, auto insurance and motorcycle insurance. This is not a commercial insurance broker position, although there could be exposure to commercial insurance in the future.

Our new customers approach us online, call in or visit our office. There is little or no cold-calling that you would have to do.

Your role as a RIBO agent is key in our organization because we have high aspirations to keep growing. We are working hard to become a major insurance broker in Ontario.

Our current staff came to work for us and stayed, for good reasons. We are a place that capable brokers stay and prosper.


The Opportunity for Growth (Really Does Exist Here):

You will be joining a growing organization, at the right time in our growth curve, to allow you to shape your career and advance rapidly.

Are you energetic, passionate, dynamic and love learning? Are you committed about advancing in your career as a broker? Then this could be the opportunity you have been waiting for.


The Latest Technology Awaits You:

We believe that you need the best tools to work with. That’s why technology adoption is an intrinsic part of our success. Our investment in the latest cutting-edge technology resulted in a CSIO Technology Leader award in 2017.

What It Takes – You Have to Be Able To:

  • Prepare accurate quotes by using the Applied Rating Services (Compuquote) software
  • Accurately read and interpret MVR and Autoplus reports
  • Enjoy the sales process and its challenges
  • Use your sales broker skills to successfully sell auto insurance and home insurance to new customers
  • Act as an Insurance Advisor by connecting with insurers and underwriters to discuss and submit auto insurance and home insurance risks. Exposure to specialty insurance (e.g. marine insurance) is minimal
  • Be a ‘Go-Getter’ and maintain a positive “Can Do” attitude


You Need:

  • A RIBO license. CAIB and/or CIP is a bonus
  • Recent experience (2 years to 10 years is ideal) as an Insurance Broker, Insurance Customer Service Representative, TSR or Underwriter
  • A resume that shows your prior sales success figures (insurance related or not)
  • A working knowledge of several insurance company portals, like Intact, Aviva, RSA, Economical, Travelers, Chieftain, Pembridge, Echelon, Perth, Jevco and Pafco
  • Prior experience working with Power Broker or any other broker management system (e.g. TAM, Epic, SigXP)
  • Prior experience working with the Applied Rating Services (Compuquote) software
  • Basic skills in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel
  • Confidence in your ability to sell
  • A love for learning new ways of doing things
  • Enthusiasm for dealing with people and helping them get what they need


We Offer You:

  • A convenient office location. Our office is easily accessible.
  • A Group Benefits package that gives you peace of mind.
  • Retirement Savings Plan contributions are available to select positions within the organization.


About Us:

We are an ideal insurance brokerage for a young insurance broker who is looking for a career, not just a job, and has 2-10 years of experience. We are not looking for beginners.

This is an inside sales role and we provide the leads. We are an established brokerage that has invested a lot in technology. We deal with top insurers in the country and have high growth aspirations. Our staff is mature with many years of experience and can provide guidance and support to your career. Many will retire in the next 4-5 years, creating opportunities for you to move into a leadership role.

Thus, this is the perfect timing for a career-oriented younger broker who is looking for rapid advancement into a management role within the next few years.

We are looking for winners that want to be part of a great company. Can you help us achieve 10x growth in the next 5-10 years? Let’s talk. We have more than tripled our marketing budget in the last 2 years and will continue to increase the marketing spend. It pays.


Are You Interested, But Not Sure If the Fit is Right?

Roles that we consider as valuable prior experience are:

  • Insurance Broker, Account Manager
  • Personal Lines Insurance Broker
  • Personal Lines Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Customer Service
  • Sales Insurance Advisor
  • RIBO Licensed Insurance Advisor
  • Insurance Sales Representative CSR
  • Junior Broker, Client Advocate, Associate Insurance Advisor
  • Client Manager Personal Lines, Registered Insurance Broker
  • Technical Service Representative, TSR, Personal Lines TSR
  • Underwriter or Junior Underwriter.


This is a full-time job.

Required experience: General P& C Insurance, minimum 2 years recent.

To apply now, email your application to careers@levitt.ca


Like the work, love the career? Call us!

title: Executive Administrative Assistant
description:
EXECUTIVE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT

Ayr Farmers Mutual Insurance Company is seeking an Executive Administrative Assistant to join our team of insurance professionals.

About Ayr Farmers Mutual

Ayr Farmers Mutual is a financially strong, Policyholder owned, progressive property and casualty mutual insurer with written premiums of $40 million annually. We offer farm, residential, commercial, marine, and automobile protection and coverage through a dedicated network of Agents and Brokers. We service the Southwestern Ontario region, and are located in close proximity to Kitchener, Waterloo and Cambridge.

Since 1893, the knowledgeable and caring team members of Ayr Farmers Mutual have been providing products and services that provide protection and peace of mind for our Policyholders and the community. What makes us different is our commitment to developing strong relationships and providing outstanding, personalized customer service. We continually strive to put our Policyholders and our communities first, and to ensure that every individual we serve is treated with fairness and respect.

The Company provides training, education, work life balance (hybrid work environment), wellness opportunities, community contributions and a fun and friendly working environment.

Ayr Farmers Mutual is proud of our culture. We live by our core values and genuinely care for one another and our Policyholders. We celebrate our successes and have a supportive work environment that encourages everyone to be their best.

Executive Administrative Assistant

As an Executive Administrative Assistant, you will have the opportunity to provide high-level administrative support to the management team. This position will work closely with all managers and executives, offering administrative expertise with formatting and editing written communications and reports, and developing presentations. Attention to detail and organizational skills are prioritized for this role, as the successful candidate will also be responsible to plan and co-ordinate arrangements for industry related conventions, educational sessions, and ensure minutes from meetings are accurate and complete. The ideal candidate will thrive in a team environment.

Responsibilities:

· Provide administrative assistance to the management team that includes formatting and editing communications and reports, and developing presentations

· Receive and take minutes of department meetings or other special meetings, as required

· Plan and co-ordinate arrangements for attendees at industry related conventions, seminars, educational sessions, or meetings for management, staff, and agents, as required

· Maintain Policyholder confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential

· Participate on various committees and special projects, as required

Skills & Experience:

· Post-secondary education or equivalent experience is required

· 1 year experience as an Administrative Assistant, preferred

· Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite

· Self-motivated with a strong work ethic

· Strong collaboration and organizational skills, with the ability to work within a team environment and embrace change

· Exceptional oral and written communication skills required.

· Strong attention to detail

· Thrive in a fast-paced working environment, that requires attention to competing priorities

*This position will be a hybrid role with the opportunity to work in the office and remotely.

Accommodation at Ayr Farmers Mutual Insurance Company

We are committed to a selection process and work environment that is inclusive and barrier free. Human Resources will work with the applicant and the selection committee to arrange reasonable and appropriate accommodation for the selection process which will enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.

To learn more about Ayr Farmers Mutual, visit our website at

https://www.ayrmutual.com/

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Company events
  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flextime
  • Life insurance
  • On-site gym
  • On-site parking
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Monday to Friday
Show more

title: Underwriting Administrative Assistant
description:
Built on meritocracy, our unique company culture rewards self-starters and those who are committed to doing what is best for our customers.
If you are looking for a fast paced, motivating, hybrid work environment with great benefits, with the opportunity to assist in the development of a new and growing team within a growing organization, you may be the exact person we are looking for!
Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd. is currently seeking enthusiastic, driven individuals to join our Triage/ Speed Underwriting Administration Team.
This position assists in the maintenance of policy renewals in collaboration with Underwriters and presents opportunities to grow within our company.
It is suitable for a candidate with prior industry experience, looking for the opportunity to work in commercial lines and learn from our established team of experts.
Due to the ongoing circumstances with the Covid-19 pandemic, you must have the ability to work from home for the foreseeable future, with the eventual expansion to a hybrid work from home/ office model.
As an Underwriting Assistant/Renewal Underwriter
  • Work collaboratively within a dynamic team structure
  • Support underwriters with maintenance, and organization of files
  • Perform underwriting support functions at the direction of underwriters including preparing quotes, bind confirmations, and certificates with a high degree of accuracy
  • Preparing Certificates of Insurance
  • Editing & formatting of documents using a variety of software & programs
  • Reviewing documents for accuracy
  • Maintain/ innovate administrative workflow procedures to increase efficiency
  • Communicate internally with other departments via e-mail and telephone
  • Communicate externally with brokers as required
  • Carry out other clerical duties as required

What you bring to the team:
  • Strong organization, prioritization, and time management skills to complete assignments efficiently and within structured timelines
  • An eye for detail to handle policy correspondence and documents with a high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
  • Positive, driven, and disciplined attitude
  • Solution, problem solving oriented
  • Self-motivated to meet competitive individual and team-related targets
  • Strong independent work ethic
  • Ability to work harmoniously in a team environment & collaborate with teammates
  • Strong written language, and professional communication skills
  • Flexible and adaptable to change
  • Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite

What SRIM has to offer:
  • A fulfilling company culture that provides personal support & mentorship, professional growth, and career advancement.
  • Bonus Structure
  • Company matched RRSP’s
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) through our parent company Brown & Brown (BRO)
  • Extended medical benefits through Canada Life
  • Continuing education and professional designation subsidy
  • A positive and collaborative environment; teammates are rewarded on their performance and achievement of goals.
  • An environment where a proactive and entrepreneurial attitude thrives

Company Background
We are an award-winning incorporated Managing General Agent (MGA) serving Canada's specialty and niche product insurance markets, offering one of the most comprehensive product lines available. Established over 20 years ago, Special Risk Insurance Managers has grown to encompass a wide range of niche and specialty products including Hard to Place Casualty & Property, High Value Residential, Sports, Leisure & Entertainment; Health & Beauty, Special Events, Inland Marine, Logging, Aviation and Marine.
Throughout our growth, we have remained true to what has enabled our success: our work culture, service to our brokers, and strong relationships with our markets.
**Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We take pride in the diversity of our team and seek diversity in our applicants.
Show more

title: Commercial Lines Underwriter (Construction)
description:
Premier (Premier Marine/Premier Canada) is one of Canada’s largest Managing Underwriting Agencies. A leader in the Specialty Insurance industry, 100% Canadian owned. Our people are committed to performance, positive outcomes, and career development that lead to mutual success for our organization, our valued employees, our partners and clients.

Whether you’re starting your career or taking it to the next level, Premier offers a unique environment for you to grow & succeed. If you believe in a job well done, then consider the following:

DEPARTMENT/LOCATION: Commercial Lines (Construction), London or Vancouver
POSITION: Commercial Underwriter

Job Accountabilities:

In this position, you will underwrite and develop our Commercial portfolio, with the mandate to grow profitability, maintaining exceptional working relationships with our brokers/agents. This position requires a candidate with strong technical and underwriting expertise to provide support within the Commercial/Professional lines team. The incumbent should be an adept communicator to confidently respond to and resolve broker/agent inquiries, and someone who is capable of making operational decisions with autonomy within your level of authority.

Qualifications & Skills Required:

  • Minimum 1-3 years of company underwriting experience, handling/quoting mid-sized Commercial accounts
  • CIP or working towards completing CIP courses
  • Good solid relationships
  • Excellent awareness and understanding of the marketplace
  • A high standard of service in handling queries
  • Strong computer skills including knowledge of Microsoft Office applications

About Premier:

Founded in 1989, Premier is head quartered in Vancouver, with 5 additional offices located across Canada - Toronto, London, Cambridge, Laval, and Calgary. With over 150 employees, Premier’s companies include Premier Canada, Premier Marine, and Oceanic. Visit our website for more information on our company and our unique specialty insurance products. www.premiergroup.ca

When you join Premier, you join a growing organization that’s focused on providing first class innovative insurance solutions! We will collaborate with you to develop your skills and talents to their fullest potential, exposing you to a broad range of assignments and continuous learning opportunities in a dynamic fast paced environment.

We offer you a comprehensive benefit plan, offering exceptional health, medical, dental, vision care and life insurance; etc.

title: Receptionist
description:
Company Background

Special Risk Insurance Managers Ltd. is an industry leading Managing General Agent established over 20 years ago. Our roots derive from a long serving sports, entertainment and lifestyle insurance provider (Sports-Can Insurance Consultants) and we have grown to encompass a wide range of niche and specialty products including aviation, marine, specialty casualty, accident, AD&D and hard to place property.

We are looking to add to our growing team with a full-time permanent receptionist/processor. This position is suitable for those without any industry knowledge, but who hold some form of customer service experience as this is an entry-level position.

**This position is based in-office 5 days per week as part of a small core group of full-time in-office staff.**

Duties:

- Reception – answering & transferring calls

- Accepting deliveries as required

- Process/typing a variety of insurance related documents

- Process policy changes, certificates & endorsements as required

- Assist underwriting staff with servicing files & attaching pertinent information to files

- Communicate with brokers via e-mail & telephone

- Clerical duties, such as electronic filing & maintenance of records

Minimum Job Qualifications & Key Personal Attributes:

- Strong organizational & time management skills to complete assignments effectively and within structured timelines

- Strong writing/language & communication skills

- Keen eye for detail

- Interest in being involved with community outreach and company culture

- Understanding of Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Office 365 & Google Drive is an asset

- High school diploma

- Customer service experience – positive & professional communication skills

- Double vaccinated against Covid-19

What SRIM has to offer:

- A fulfilling company culture that provides personal support & mentorship, professional growth & career advancement opportunities

- A positive & collaborative environment

- Teammates are rewarded on performance & achievement of goals

- We encourage and subsidize continuing education & professional designations

- Extended medical & dental benefits through Canada Life

- Employee Stock Purchase Plan through our parent company Brown & Brown, Inc. (BRO)

- RRSP Matching Program

Job Type: Full-time Permanent (37.5 hrs/week)

Location: Langley (in-office) - must reside in Metro Vancouver/Fraser Valley

Starting Salary: $35,000-$40,000

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $35,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations:
Our office has very a limited number of visits, primarily from delivery services. Masks are required. We are strictly observing the current PHO guidelines. Proof of vaccination required.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $36,500.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee stock purchase plan
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
Our office has very a limited number of visits, primarily from delivery services. Masks are required. We are strictly observing the current PHO guidelines. Proof of vaccination required.

  • Secondary School (preferred)

Experience:

  • MS Word: 2 years (preferred)
  • Customer Service: 2 years (preferred)

title: Underwriter
description:
You’re excited by a challenge.
You’re passionate about building relationships with brokers, giving great service, and the world of underwriting and risk assessment
If you’re answer is yes, check out this Underwriter role at Cowan Insurance Group.
What’s the ask?
Reporting to the Director, Commercial Insurance, the Underwriter is responsible for underwriting the personal and commercial accounts, including marine pleasure craft, self-storage, and high-risk residential programs. The incumbent will underwrite in accordance with the guidelines and rules applicable to the programs, provide quotes on new business, process renewals, policy changes and cancellations. As an Underwriter you will be responsible for developing relationships with the broker networks, attend industry events and assist management in the implementation of new programs, new systems and new procedures. You will be involved in program audits, annual program reviews, recommendations/referrals for enhanced coverages, carrier relationship building, systems changes and claims.
What does it take?

  • Previous underwriting experience in PI or CI required
  • Knowledge of various underwriting tools an asset such as BVS, etc.
  • Lloyds coverholder processes and bordereaux experience an asset
  • Knowledge of boats would be an asset (either power or sail)
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • High level of self-motivation with ability to perform effectively with minimal supervision
  • Attention to detail and ability to process large volume of transactions accurately
  • Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS office products
  • Working towards CIP designation an asset
  • RIBO license or ability to obtain.

Who we are

Canadian-owned and operated, Cowan Insurance Group is a leading independent insurance brokerage and consulting operation, providing real value to our clients. With close to 500 employees operating out of 12 locations across Canada, we’re proud to have been named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2012.
We partner with leading national and international insurance companies to:

  • deliver insurance and risk management solutions to businesses, organizations and individuals
  • advise on and create retirement, group benefits, disability management and international benefits programs for employee groups.

We also offer wealth and asset management as well as financial and succession planning services to individuals, and specialize in property, casualty and credit insurance.
What sets us apart?
Be in good company
Integrity matters. It drives our award-winning workplace culture and fuels our collective desire to help our clients, employees, and communities thrive.
Challenge your thinking
You're valued for your passion, drive and creativity. The pace is fast but the work is meaningful, interesting, and complex, just the way you like it.
Grow together
We believe in your potential. If you’re looking to develop your expertise with learning opportunities and mentoring, we’ll make that happen.
Benefits and perks

  • Competitive salary
  • Participate in our comprehensive benefits plan on day one — no waiting period
  • Company-matched Retirement Plan
  • Company-paid training and development courses
  • Community involvement

Are you interested?
Send your cover letter and resume and share your unique story with us.
While we appreciate the interest of all applicants, we will contact only those selected for interviews. If you are an applicant with disabilities and require accommodations, please let us know at the time of our contact so that we may arrange for their provision.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employee candidates will be selected strictly on the basis of an individual's technical qualifications, knowledge and experience, as they relate to the requirements of a particular position. Selections will be made without regard to: race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed (religion), sex, sexual orientation, handicaps (physical or mental), age, marital status, family status, or the receipt of public assistance or record of offences.

Job Type: Full-time

Show more

With close to 500 employees operating out of 12 locations across Canada, we’re proud to have been named one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies since 2012.We partner with leading national and international insurance companies to:', 'Excellent computer skills and knowledge of MS office products', 'Previous underwriting experience in PI or CI required', 'Working towards CIP designation an asset', 'High level of self-motivation with ability to perform effectively with minimal supervision']

title: Claims Examiner
description:
:
Responsibilities:
  • Working as a Third Party Administrator in the investigation, analysis, and direct oversight of full case load of nationwide first party property, liability and inland marine claims, with the opportunity to expand responsibilities into other lines of business.
  • Target identification of subrogation opportunities and lead recovery efforts.
  • Review independent adjuster reports for accuracy, and direct the investigation of your claims.
  • Promptly communicate with Lloyd’s of London brokers and underwriting and claims personnel of other Carrier clients to provide outstanding customer service and results.
  • Promptly communicate with insureds, claimants, retail agents, general agents, independent adjusters and attorneys as necessary. Strategize and take action to obtain best possible results for claims.
  • This position requires a high degree of knowledge with regard to all aspects of first and third party coverage.
  • Must be able to review insurance policy coverage, and prepare reservation of rights or declination letters when appropriate.
  • Be an organized, effective communicator, and possess excellent analytical, writing, negotiation, and follow-up skills
Qualifications:
  • Post-secondary education
  • Ability to read, understand, and apply policy terms
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of first-party property and third-party liability adjusting experience
  • Third party adjusting experience an advantage
  • Insurance designations and commitment to ongoing insurance education preferred
  • Exemplary customer service
  • Ability to accurately handle a full case load in a fast paced environment
  • Ability and willingness to commit to extended schedules following significant catastrophe losses
  • Outstanding organizational skills and maintenance of diary system
  • Competence in using MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook and the ability to learn new IT applications such as carrier or TPA systems
The Ideal Candidate:
  • You’re organized and a master multi-tasker. You are attentive to detail and can effectively manage your time and priorities in a fast-paced environment.
  • You’re analytical. You connect the dots and apply what you learned to solve problems.
  • You take initiative. You don’t wait until you are told what to do. You anticipate project needs and are resourceful in getting the required information to get your job done.
  • You’re a collaborative and business savvy individual willing to work across business units with a variety of stakeholders, demonstrating curiosity to learn beyond your own function.
  • You’re a team-player. Our office has a collaborative atmosphere where learning from others and teaching others is important.
  • You’re professional and client-oriented. We service clients across the globe and take pride in our professional work environment and reputation.
  • You take ownership of the success of the organization and your actions contribute directly to our growth and profitability.
About Our Company:
Kaufman Claims is a subsidiary of the H.W. Kaufman Group. Our family of companies comprises a vast network of over 50 offices across the globe. From brokerage, underwriting, premium financing and real estate to claims and loss control, together we are shaping the future of insurance.
Show more

title: Engineering Field Specialist
description:
We have a career opportunity for Boiler Machinery Engineers for the BC and Quebec region. Reporting to Engineering Supervisor, you will manage an assigned inspection territory, providing jurisdictional inspections; loss prevention, and claims adjusting. You will be responsible to Engineering Underwriting for technical support.
Accountabilities:
  • You will own the inspection of insured risks to assess exposures and equipment, production flow and safe operation of equipment, and jurisdictional inspections.
  • Your ability to successfully handle loss adjustment investigations from date reported to final invoices will be key in this role.
  • Motivation and diligence in the approach to being fully versed in the interpretation of all policy forms.
  • Your fluid communication skills, and existing knowledge will be instrumental in writing inspection reports and certificates of inspection.
  • We pride ourselves in quality assurance, your focus will be the completion of repair approvals and the administration aligned to the task.
  • Ability to craft survey reports for quotes on complex accounts prior to binding is a requirement.
  • Working with and building relationships with Brokers to provide marketing services and accompany brokers on site visits.
Required Qualifications and Knowledge:
  • 3 to 5 years' experience in building or production facility maintenance
  • Post-secondary technical education / apprentice
  • Strong communication and the ability to interact with others with technical and non-technical verbiage
  • Bilingualism ( for the Quebec region role )
  • Self-motivated, organized, and a dedication to meeting deadlines are essential to the success of the role.
  • Proficiency in MS word, excel, power point, and experience with databases.
  • We asked that you have a valid driver’s license due to the required travel in the role.
  • A post-secondary engineering degree or diploma is required
  • Marine engineer 2nd class / stationary engineer 2nd class
  • Background in non-destructive testing
  • Knowledge of ASME codes
  • National Board Commission
  • CIP, CRM
  • This is a field role and part of a virtual team. Working from home and extensive travel for inspections, claims, and broker training is a requirement. Flexibility is a requirement for this role.
Show more
